title: Commercial Mortgage & Listing Real Estate Virtual Assistant
description:
Role Overview

We are looking for a highly detail oriented Commercial Real Estate Virtual Assistant to support both a commercial listing agent and a commercial mortgage broker. You will handle research, underwriting support, lease review, document organization, and CRM tasks using tools like CoStar, Crexi, and Salesforce.

Key Responsibilities

• CRE research & data gathering

• Use CoStar, Crexi, title profile and other tools to research properties, owners, tenants, sales comps, and lease comps.

• Research closed transactions and summarize key data points (price, cap rate, rent, terms, concessions, etc.).

• Leases, rent rolls & financials

• Read and interpret commercial leases (AIR, CAR, and custom forms).

• Prepare clear lease abstracts capturing term, rent, options, NNN/CAM structure, reimbursements, caps, and unusual clauses.

• Analyze rent rolls and historical operating statements; normalize income and expenses based on provided guidelines.

• Underwriting & deal sizing

• Assist with underwriting for listings and financing using existing Excel models and SOPs.

• “Size up” deals for owner user and investment loans using provided metrics and lender criteria (DSCR, LTV, minimum coverage, etc.).

• Build new Excel underwriting templates for different deal types and help troubleshoot / correct formulas in existing spreadsheets.

• Transaction & document support

• Work with title and escrow: help review title reports, escrow instructions, and closing documents under guidance.

• Organize and maintain digital files for each deal (leases, financials, reports, photos, OMs, LOIs, term sheets).

• Assist in preparing listing packages, basic OMs, and finance packages from templates.

• CRM & admin support

• Update and maintain Salesforce (or similar CRM) with properties, contacts, activities, and pipeline stages.

• Prepare call lists, follow up lists, and weekly status reports for active listings and loan files.

• Manage calendars, schedule calls, and coordinate with clients, lenders, title, and escrow as needed.

Required Qualifications

• At least 2+ years of experience as a real estate VA or in a related CRE / lending / property management role.

• Practical knowledge of commercial real estate transactions and documents, including title and escrow.

• Strong ability to read, understand, and analyze commercial leases and produce lease abstracts.

• Solid understanding of basic underwriting concepts:

• Net Operating Income (NOI), Debt Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR), capitalization rate, Loan to Value (LTV), Cash on Cash return (COC), operating expense ratios.

• Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and PDF tools (data cleanup, formulas, pivots, comments, PDF editing/annotation).

• Experience with CoStar, Crexi, and title profile tools or similar real estate data platforms.

• Experience working with Salesforce or related CRM platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Pipedrive, RealNex) for data entry, tracking, and reporting.

• Excellent written and spoken English, comfortable communicating with brokers, clients, title officers, escrow officers, and lenders via
, chat, and Zoom.

• High attention to detail, accuracy with numbers, and the ability to follow detailed SOPs and checklists.

Preferred (Nice to Have)

• Prior experience supporting a commercial mortgage broker or commercial lender.

• Familiarity with AI tools for document review (e.g., AI lease abstraction, PDF analyzers) and willingness to learn new software quickly.

• Experience with U.S. commercial property types: industrial, retail, office, multifamily, and specialized assets.

Work Schedule & Compensation

• Location: Philippines (remote).

• Schedule: Must overlap at least 4–6 hours with U.S. Pacific Time (Los Angeles) business hours, Monday–Friday.

• Compensation: Please include your desired monthly salary in USD for a full time role (40 hours/week).

How to Apply

Please submit:

• A brief introduction explaining your commercial real estate and/or lending experience.

• A list of the tools and platforms you have used (CoStar, Crexi, Excel, CRM systems, title/escrow systems, AI tools).

• Work samples (if available): a redacted lease abstract, underwriting spreadsheet, or summary you created.

• Your internet speed test result, current computer specs, and your available working hours in Philippine time and Pacific Time.

About the Opportunity



We are seeking a Philippines-based Senior Accountant (VA) on behalf of our Australia-based client to support his fast-growing Australian businesses led by a high-energy, systems-driven founder. This is a senior, embedded role for an accountant who brings structure, clarity, and steady execution in a fast-paced environment. You will work closely with leadership, taking ownership of financial operations while translating complex financial data into clear, actionable insights.



This position is ideal for someone who is grounded, highly detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable with pace, volume, and ambiguity—someone who thrives in turning complexity into structured systems, consistent rhythm, and strong follow-through.

Manage and maintain accurate financial records using Xero

Prepare and deliver management reports and financial summaries for leadership

Support Australian business compliance workflows (in coordination with external advisors)

Improve and document financial systems, processes, and controls

Proactively identify risks, gaps, and opportunities within the numbers

Work closely with a high-energy founder, absorbing ideas and turning them into structure and execution.



You’re a Strong Fit If You Have:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance (CPA preferred)

Senior-level accounting experience

Strong, hands-on expertise in Xero

Experience supporting Australian businesses

Confidence managing cashflow, reporting, and financial operations independently

Excellent written and spoken English communication skills

A proactive mindset—you anticipate needs rather than wait for instructions

Strong follow-through and attention to detail

Energy & Work Style Alignment (Critical)



You will thrive in this role if you are:

Grounded, steady, and calm under pressure

Detail-oriented and process-driven

Comfortable with urgency, pace, and ambiguity

Able to work at both strategic and execution levels

Skilled at turning fast-moving ideas into systems, cadence, and results

This role is not suitable for individuals who require step-by-step direction, are sensitive to urgency, or prefer purely task-based work. Energy alignment is as important as technical skill.



Why Join?

Fully remote, Philippines-based role

Senior-level ownership—not just bookkeeping

Opportunity to scale hours and responsibility once embedded

Space to bring structure, ideas, and improvements to the table

title: Creative YouTube Editor (From Twitch VODs) - Paid Per Video, Long-Term
description:
Kamusta!!

I’m looking for a sharp, independent video editor to turn my Twitch streams into high-retention YouTube videos (roughly 8–15+ minutes).



This is not basic clip cutting.

You’ll review full VODs, identify strong 
nts, and shape them into videos with good pacing and retention.



My content is calm, conversational, and dense (fitness, mindset, lifestyle). I’m looking for someone who understands why a 
nt works; not just how to cut it.



Workflow (Designed to Stay Hands-Off for Me):

 - You pull directly from my Twitch VODs (no files sent)

– You identify 1 strong segment or theme per video

– You send timestamps + a 1-sentence hook for quick approval

– You edit the full video + create a CTR-focused thumbnail

– You send a draft (Drive link); max 1 feedback round

– Final delivery ? I upload

– Target: 1–3 videos per week

As trust builds, approval friction drops. The goal is autonomy.



What You’re Responsible For:

– Watch long VODs (2–4 hours)

– Identify 
nts worth turning into full YouTube videos

– Edit for pacing, structure, and viewer retention

– Create clean, clickable thumbnails

– Work independently and meet deadlines



Requirements:

– Experience editing long-form YouTube videos (Big plus if you have successful work with other YouTubers: share links)

– Understanding of hooks and retention (not just transitions)

– Good English reading comprehension

– Reliable internet + ability to work async

– Tools: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve; Canva or Photoshop



Livestream, gaming, or fitness content experience is a plus.



Pay (Per Video):

• $15–25 USD per long-form YouTube video (8–15 min)

• Paid trial video

• Performance bonuses for strong CTR & retention

• Rates increase with trust, autonomy, and results



Bonuses & Growth:

– Long-term collaboration for editors who show judgment and taste

– Opportunity to expand into lifestyle / IRL content over time

– Potential path to full channel autonomy as output scales



How to Apply (Top Applicants Only):

1. Please share 2–3 links to long-form YouTube videos you've edited.

2. Answer this: “From a 3-hour Twitch VOD, what 
nt would you turn into a YouTube video — and why?”

3. One sentence on why you enjoy finding strong 
nts in long streams



Applications without examples or answers will be ignored.

Shortlisted applicants will receive a paid trial video.

Role Overview



3D Walkabout is looking for a Unity VR developer with strong experience building applications for Meta Quest headsets. This role is focused on developing, maintaining, and shipping VR experiences on Quest 2 and Quest 3, primarily using Unity, Meta SDK and OpenXR.



This is a hands-on role suited to someone who is comfortable working close to the hardware, cares about performance, and understands the constraints of standalone VR. You will be working on real client and internal projects, not prototypes that never ship.



What You’ll Be Doing



- Develop VR applications in Unity for Meta Quest 2 and Quest 3

- Implement VR interactions using hand tracking and controllers

- Work with MR features such as passthrough where required

- Optimise scenes for performance, memory, and battery life on standalone headsets

- Integrate UI, interactions, audio, and gameplay systems into production-ready builds

- Collaborate with artists to ensure assets are Quest-ready and performant



Tools & Technologies



Essential



- Unity (C#) with shipped VR projects

- Meta Quest SDK / OpenXR

- XR Interaction Toolkit or custom interaction systems

- Performance optimisation for standalone VR

- Git and collaborative workflows



Preferred



- Hand tracking and mixed reality on Quest

- Shader Graph or lightweight custom shaders

- Unity URP for VR

- Experience profiling with Unity Profiler and Meta tools

- Building APKs and managing Quest deployment pipelines

- Networking / Multiplayer – Photon, Netcode for GameObjects



About You



- 3+ years professional experience with Unity

- Direct experience shipping VR content, ideally on Meta Quest

- Comfortable debugging performance and interaction issues

- Able to work independently and communicate clearly in a remote team

- Detail-oriented and focused on delivering stable, usable builds



Bonus Experience



- Training, simulation, or enterprise VR

- Tooling or editor scripts in Unity

- Networking or data-driven VR applications

- Experience porting projects between platforms



What You’ll Get



- Focused VR work on real projects that ship

- Exposure to Quest-first and MR applications

- Direct collaboration with senior XR and 3D developers

- Opportunity to grow with an established XR studio



About Us



3D Walkabout is an Australian 3D visualisation and XR studio creating immersive content for clients across property, infrastructure, education, and industry. We blend creativity, technology, and storytelling to bring digital environments and products to life through 3D, VR, AR, and interactive experiences.



How to Apply



Send us:



- Your CV or LinkedIn profile

- A portfolio or GitHub showing Unity VR work

- A short note about your experience with Meta Quest or standalone VR

title: NEMT Routing Specialist
description:
Hiring Filipino and Philippine-based professionals only!



Wingz, is a leading US rideshare company focused on Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT). 

Visit our website: 



Job Summary:



The NEMT Routing Specialist plays a critical role in the day-to-day operations of our transportation services. This role involves planning efficient routes, assigning trips to drivers, negotiating trip acceptance, and ensuring schedules run smoothly. Strong presentation and negotiation skills are key to motivating drivers to accept assigned trips and maintaining operational efficiency.



You will work closely with U.S.-based operations staff and drivers to optimize scheduling, improve trip efficiency, and maintain a high standard of service for patients.



 Work Schedule:  US Hours (EST)

 Work Setup:  Remote | Independent Contractor

 Employment Type:  Full-Time | Long-Term Opportunity

 Fixed Salary: USD 900/ Month

 Perks:  10 PTO days + HMO (after probation)

 Payout:  Semi-Monthly

 Equipment:  Self-Provided



Key Responsibilities:



• Plan, schedule, and optimize daily transportation routes for NEMT drivers.

• Assign trips to drivers and ensure acceptance through effective communication, presentation, and negotiation.

• Monitor driver schedules and adjust routes as needed for delays, cancellations, or emergencies.

• Communicate with drivers proactively to resolve concerns, provide support, and encourage timely trip acceptance.

• Ensure all trips comply with NEMT regulatory requirements and company policies.

• Maintain accurate records of trips, drivers, and route changes using company software.

• Collaborate with dispatch, operations, and customer support teams to resolve scheduling conflicts.

• Identify opportunities to improve routing efficiency and reduce operational costs.

• Generate reports on route performance, on-time metrics, and driver engagement.

• Provide insights and recommendations to management to enhance overall transportation operations.



Qualifications:



• At least 2 years of experience in routing, dispatch, logistics coordination, or transportation planning (experience with NEMT or U.S.-based operations is a plus).

• Background in sales, customer service, or client engagement is highly preferred to leverage presentation and negotiation skills with drivers.

• Strong English communication skills (verbal and written).

• Ability to motivate and influence drivers to accept trips while maintaining positive relationships.

• Familiarity with routing and mapping software (e.g., Google Maps, Waze, or route optimization tools).

• Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and time management skills.

• Ability to multitask and manage last-minute changes effectively.

• High attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping.

• Comfortable working with U.S. time zones (EST).

• Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet workspace suitable for remote work.



Preferred Skills (Optional but Advantageous):



• Prior experience in Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT) operations.

• Familiarity with NEMT software platforms.

• Knowledge of U.S. transportation regulations and compliance requirements.

• Experience in data analysis or route optimization strategies.



What We Offer:



• Competitive monthly compensation in USD 

• Performance-based monthly bonus ($
per month)

• Paid training and onboarding

• Long-term and stable remote opportunity

• Opportunity for career growth in operations

description:

Job Summary:

As a Fullstack Engineer (Django + React Native) at Wingz, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining backend APIs and mobile application features. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable, scalable, and high-performance software supporting our NEMT platform.

This role requires strong experience in Django/Django REST Framework and at least 1+ year of hands-on experience with React Native.



Key Responsibilities:



Develop and Maintain Web Applications:

• Design, develop, and maintain scalable APIs using Django REST framework

• Write clean, efficient, and reusable code following best practices and coding standards.

• Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.



Develop and Maintain Backend & Mobile Application

• Design, develop, and maintain scalable APIs using Django and Django REST Framework.

• Build and enhance mobile application features using React Native for iOS and Android.

• Write clean, efficient, and reusable code following industry best practices.

• Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of backend services and mobile applications.



Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams:

• Work closely with front-end developers, designers, and product managers to implement new features and improve existing ones.

• Participate in code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback to ensure code quality.

• Collaborate with DevOps engineers to optimize deployment processes and infrastructure.



Database Management:

• Design and optimize database schemas.

• Write efficient queries and manage database migrations.

• Ensure data integrity and security.



Testing and Debugging:

• Write unit tests and perform debugging to ensure the reliability of applications.

• Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely manner.

• Conduct regular performance testing and optimize code for better performance.



Documentation and Technical Support:

• Maintain comprehensive documentation of the codebase and technical processes.

• Provide technical support and guidance to tea
mbers and stakeholders.

• Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve skills and knowledge.



Requirements:

• Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in web development using Django and Django REST framework.

• Proficiency in Python, Django, and Django REST framework.

• At least 1 year of hands-on experience in React Native mobile development (mandatory requirement).

• Strong understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

• Experience with RESTful APIs and web services.

• Familiarity with database systems (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.).

• Knowledge of version control systems, particularly Git.

• Experience with Docker and containerization is a plus.

• Understanding of cloud services (AWS, GCP, etc.) is advantageous.

• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

• Strong communication and collaboration skills.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

• Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.



Nice to have:

• Experience with front-end frameworks such as Vue.js or React (web)

• Experience with additional mobile frameworks (e.g., Flutter)

title: Data Engineer
description:
Hiring Filipino and Philippine-based professionals only!



Wingz, is a leading US rideshare company focused on Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT). 

Visit our website: 



Position: Data Engineer

Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, (US EST Time)

Employment Set-up: Remote (Independent Contractor)

Salary Range: USD 1,500 - 2,500/ Month

Pay-out Frequency: Semi-Monthly

Benefits: Unlimited PTO and HMO after the probationary period

Equipment: Self-Provided



Job Summary:

The Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining scalable, secure, and reliable data infrastructure that powers analytics, product insights, and operational efficiency at Wingz. This role turns raw data into actionable insights across areas like performance analytics, route optimization, compliance reporting, and driver behavior.

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, highly proficient in SQL, experienced in BI tools (Superset is a plus), and committed to ensuring data quality across development cycles. This role works closely with engineering, QA, product, and business teams to enable data-driven decision-making and maintain a trusted data ecosystem.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Test Design & Execution:

• Develop, execute, and maintain manual and automated test cases, test scripts, and test plans to ensure software quality.

• Identify test scenarios based on software requirements and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.



2. Software Testing:

• Conduct functional, regression, integration, and performance testing to validate software functionality and system performance.

• Assist in verifying software compliance with business requirements, industry standards, and company quality guidelines.



3. Defect Tracking & Issue Resolution:

• Identify, document, and report software defects using issue-tracking tools (e.g., Jira, Trello).

• Work with developers to troubleshoot, reproduce, and resolve issues in test environments.

• Verify bug fixes and updates before production deployment.



4. Automation & Continuous Improvement:

• Contribute to the maintenance and improvement of automated test suites, frameworks, and testing tools to enhance efficiency.

• Identify opportunities to automate repetitive test cases for increased accuracy and speed.



5. Collaboration & Reporting:

• Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business analysts, to understand project goals and testing needs.

• Analyze and interpret test results, prepare detailed test reports, and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

• Assist in diagnosing and resolving issues reported by users and internal teams.



Qualifications:



• 4+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role, with strong expertise in SQL.

• Proven experience in querying relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.

• Experience with cloud-based databases (e.g., AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Azure SQL Database).

• Knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g., Superset, Looker, Qlik, or Domo).

• Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying, data manipulation, and optimization.

• Strong understanding of database management systems (DBMS) and data warehousing concepts.

• Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools is preferred.

• Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.

• Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.

• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

• Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.

• Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

title: ???? We’re Hiring: Operations & Content Virtual Assistant (20 hrs/week)
description:
We’re looking for a highly organized, proactive Virtual Assistant to support a thought leader in speaking, podcasting, content, and business operations.

This role is not task-by-task—it’s ownership-driven. You’ll help keep multiple moving parts on track and make sure nothing stalls.

If you love systems, deadlines, follow-ups, and turning ideas into published work—this is for you.



? Role Overview



Hours: 20 hours/week

Check-in: Weekly 30–45 minute call

Style: Outcome-based, deadline-driven, proactive

Tools: Excel, Canva, LinkedIn, podcast platforms, QuickBooks, basic SEO tools



???? Key Responsibilities & Time Allocation

1?? Speaking & Conference Pipeline (Primary Priority – 45–50%)

You will manage and grow the speaking pipeline using an existing Excel tracker.

Weekly Expectations:

Research & add 15 leadership / HR / tech conferences

Prioritize best-fit opportunities

Draft 3–5 tailored speaker applications (for review)

 event organizers for deadlines & speaking details

Build relationships with event planners

Keep tracker fully updated with status



Weekly Success Looks Like:

15 new opportunities added

3–5 applications drafted

No stalled or incomplete entries

Tracker always current



2?? Social Media & Podcast Operations (30%)

LinkedIn (Business Page):

Repost/adapt 2 posts/week from personal page

Draft aligned copy (reviewed before posting)

Post 2 additional weekly posts (research, influencer reposts, or originals)

Podcast Management:

Coordinate guest recording schedules

Create Canva images per episode

Write show notes & upload transcripts

Upload episodes to Spotify, YouTube & other platforms

Publish short clips to LinkedIn & YouTube

Draft 1–2 launch posts per episode

Upload episodes to website with images, descriptions & transcripts

Publish within 48 hours of receiving final files

Success:

2 LinkedIn business posts weekly

Podcast episode fully published when applicable

All assets uploaded on time



3?? Website & Blog Content Management (10%)

Plan 3 months of content together

Track deadlines & follow up with contributors

Light editing only (grammar/clarity—do not change voice)

Upload posts with images & basic SEO

Schedule publishing

Success:

3 blog posts published monthly

No formatting or publishing errors





4?? Book / Journal Project Support (10%)

Weekly accountability check-ins

Research quotes, references & layout ideas

Canva design (black & white)

Prepare files for Amazon (ebook & hardcover)

Design ebook + hardcover covers

Draft & schedule promo posts (before, during & after launch)

Success:

One tangible deliverable every week

(research, layout, design, or promo content



5?? QuickBooks Setup (5–10%)

Migrate income & expenses from Excel/Word

Set up invoicing

Set up 1099s

Organize expense & receivable tracking

Success (by end of February):

All historical data entered accurately

Invoices & expenses fully functional



6?? Client Onboarding Support (5–10%)

Send assessment codes with instructions (template provided)

Track completion

Consolidate results into Excel for team visibility

Success:

Immediate execution upon request

Accurate tracking

Consistent customer experience



???? Working Style & Expectations

This role requires someone who:

Proactively flags blockers

Speaks up if timelines aren’t realistic

Asks clarifying questions early

Repeats instructions to confirm understanding

Focuses on outcomes, not just tasks

Follows up firmly (including reminders) when deliverables are late

You will be expected to hold contributors accountable and keep projects moving.



? Ideal Candidate



Strong English (written & spoken)

Extremely organized & detail-oriented

Comfortable with Excel trackers & systems

Confident communicating with event planners & partners

Canva + content coordination experience

Podcast or content ops experience is a big plus

QuickBooks experience preferred





???? To Apply:

Send your resume + a short message explaining:

Your experience managing multiple projects

Your experience with content, podcasts, or speaking pipelines

Why you’re a good fit for an outcome-driven role

title: Head of Operations / COO (Execution & Scaling) – Ecommerce
description:
About Us

We run a portfolio of DTC ecommerce stores using a pod-based model. Our edge is speed: we find proven ad creatives, adapt them fast, and scale across multiple products and stores.



We are building toward 10+ pods over time and need a full-time execution leader to run day-to-day operations and make sure the company ships consistently without the founder being the bottleneck.



This is not a fractional, advisory, or consulting role.





What You’ll Own (Day-to-Day)

- Run execution across multiple pods (one pod = one store)

- Lead weekly planning and daily execution cadence

- Enforce accountability, deadlines, and output targets

- Hire, manage, and develop pod owners + execution roles

- Remove bottlenecks across creative production, media buying, CRO, and tech

- Build and enforce SOPs, templates, and operating rhythms

- Performance management (coaching, feedback, replacement when needed)

- Reporting: weekly scorecard and key escalations to the founder





What We’re Looking For

- 5+ years in operations / delivery / team leadership

- Experience managing remote teams and shipping under pressure

- Strong execution mindset: you turn messy goals into clear plans and outcomes

- Comfortable holding people accountable and making hard calls

- Experience in ecommerce, performance marketing, or agencies is a big plus



Not a fit if you are:

- Fractional COO

- Consultant / advisor

- Looking for part-time hours





Compensation

USD 4,000 – 7,000 per month base (depending on experience) + performance bonus.





How to Apply

Apply via this Google Form (required):

title: Human Resource Specialist
description:
KMR International Business Group is seeking a dedicated, detail-oriented, and people-focused Human Resource Specialist to support and manage core HR functions. This role will assist in recruitment, employee relations, HR documentation, and policy compliance, ensuring smooth day-to-day HR operations while helping foster a positive and professional work environment.





Key Responsibilities



Recruitment & Onboarding

- Assist in end-to-end recruitment processes, including job postings, applicant screening, and interview coordination

- Facilitate onboarding and orientation programs for new hires

Maintain accurate and updated recruitment and onboarding records

HR Administration & Documentation

- Prepare, update, and manage employee records, contracts, and HR files

- Ensure proper documentation of attendance, leaves, and employee information

- Assist in the preparation of HR reports and internal documentation



Employee Relations & Support

- Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries regarding HR policies and procedures

title: Technical Draftsman

We are a full-service construction corporation and contractor specializing in design-and-build solutions. Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, or a related field is preferred

Previous experience in construction or architectural drafting roles is an advantage

title: Content & Marketing Manager (YouTube + Newsletter + Social Media) | Part-Time | Long-Term
description:
Hi! I’m Tom, a Sydney-based mortgage broker and podcast host building a personal brand in the Australian property space.



I run:



- Wombat Home Loans (mortgage broking)

- The Property Web Podcast / YouTube Channel



I’m looking for a long-term marketing/content team member who can help manage and grow my content ecosystem.



This role is ideal for someone who is both strategic + hands-on (planning AND execution).



Your main focus (priority order)



1) Newsletter Subscriber Growth (high priority)

- Grow my
 list through lead magnets, funnels, opt-in pages, and content promotion

- Suggest and help implement strategies to increase newsletter signups from YouTube/podcast/social

- Track results and optimise conversion (I write the newsletter myself in Kit.com — you focus on growing the subscriber base.)



2) YouTube growth + content repurposing

- Upload and publish YouTube episodes (titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails)

- Cut Shorts/Reels from podcast recordings

- Improve YouTube packaging (titles/thumbnails/hooks)

- Coordinate freelancers for advanced video editing if needed



3) Social media execution

- Schedule Instagram +
 content

- Write captions (AI-assisted is fine, but must sound human)

- Reply to comments/DMs (LinkedIn excluded)



Tools we use

- Notion, Canva, Riverside, Buffer, Meta Suite, Google Drive, ChatGPT/Gemini, Kit, ScoreApp

- Notion experience is helpful but not essential.



How we’ll work

- Monday planning call

- Daily async updates in Notion

- Friday review call

- I will approve major decisions early on until trust is built



Who you are

- Proactive / self-starting

- Strong English writing skills

- Comfortable editing short-form video clips

- Marketing strategy mindset (not just “posting”)

- Organised and reliable (you can manage deadlines without reminders)

- Comfortable using AI tools to speed up writing and ideation



What success looks like (first 60–90 days)

- A clear content calendar and repeatable weekly workflow in Notion

- Consistent publishing of podcast clips + YouTube Shorts

- Improved YouTube titles/thumbnails and stronger packaging

- At least 1–2 lead magnet / signup funnel ideas implemented

- Measurable increase in newsletter subscribers and channel engagement



To apply - Please answer:

- What are 2 optimisations you would make to my YouTube channel to increase views/subscribers, and why?

- Also include the word WOMBAT in the first line of your application

title: Project Analyst (Asset & CMMS Integration)
description:
WE’RE HIRING — Project Analyst (Asset & CMMS Integration)



ViaCore Advisory is an Australia-based specialist asset advisory firm delivering large-scale asset auditing and data integration projects across complex built environments. We help organisations structure, validate, and integrate high-quality asset data into CMMS platforms for long-term performance and compliance.



We’re growing and looking for a Project Analyst (Asset & CMMS Integration) to join our delivery team.



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Hours: 40 hours per week

Engagement: 6-month contract (full-time/long-term employment is a possibility)



About the Role

You’ll play a key role in managing asset data quality from site capture through to CMMS handover. This includes data validation and cleansing, asset hierarchy setup, lifecycle QA, and supporting integration into systems such as SimPro, Maximo, Archibus, FMClarity, and others.



Key Qualifications

• Experience in asset data management, facilities, engineering services, or infrastructure projects

• Strong CMMS data preparation and QA experience

• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

• Strong attention to detail and ability to manage large datasets

• Ability to work autonomously in a remote environment

• Knowledge of asset frameworks (VBIS / ISO 55000) is a plus



View the full job description here:  



We offer a competitive salary package to qualified applicants. 



How to Apply:


 your updated CV to 


 subject: Application - Project Analyst – Viacore Advisory



If you’re passionate about asset data, systems integration, and delivering high-quality outcomes — we’d love to hear from you!

title: Ai Automation Specialist
description:
We are looking for a tech-forward specialist to bridge the gap between creative marketing and backend automation. You will be responsible for building and maintaining the "digital engine" of our real estate brokerage and property management firm. Your goal is to eliminate repetitive data entry, automate lead flows, and execute high-performing social media campaigns using a mix of AI, no-code tools (n8n/Manychat/Make/Claude Code), and digital design.  You will work directly with the founding team to architect, build, and optimize the digital nervous system of our company. Your mission: Use AI and automation to turn manual tasks into high-speed workflows that scale our lead generation and maximize conversions.



You Will Have Working Knowledge In:

- N8N & Make

- Claude Code

- Canva

- Meta/IG Ads

- Google Platform



The ideal candidate will be spending 40% of their time building/improving/repairing tech stack automation functions and the remaining time building marketing campaigns, increasing our digital presence with content. 



The Right Fit: You might be the person we’re looking for if you’ve ever stayed up late perfecting a complex n8n workflow just for the "aha!" 
nt when it finally runs. You don’t just use AI; you experiment with it, push its boundaries, and wonder why the rest of the world is still doing things "the old way." If you’re the person who looks at a business bottleneck and sees a beautiful automation waiting to happen, we should talk.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Description



SBO Financial is a virtual accounting and advisory firm working with high-growth eCommerce, SaaS, and digital services businesses across Australia. We help founders scale through strong financial systems, insight-driven reporting, and strategic CFO support.



We are building a stronger marketing function to grow inbound leads, increase brand authority, and better support our sales team. To support this, we are hiring a Marketing Coordinator to execute our marketing plan and run day-to-day marketing operations.



This is a hands-on, execution-focused role. You will be responsible for publishing content, managing marketing systems, coordinating campaigns, and tracking performance across our website,
, and social channels.



You will work closely with the Head of Growth and CEO to turn marketing priorities into consistent, measurable output.

This role is ideal for someone who is organised, detail-oriented, comfortable with digital tools, and enjoys seeing campaigns through from idea to execution.



Requirements



Core responsibilities

- Manage and maintain the marketing calendar across blog,
, and social channels 

- Upload, format, and publish articles in WordPress 

- Coordinate with a content writer to publish 2–4 articles per month 

- Repurpose long-form content into LinkedIn posts and
 newsletters 

- Write and schedule
 campaigns using ActiveCampaign (or similar tools) 

- Ensure brand consistency across blogs,
s, graphics, and case studies 

- Website & SEO

- Update website content, landing pages, and CTAs using WordPress and Elementor 

- Maintain SEO fundamentals including metadata, headings, internal linking, and keyword usage 

- Monitor performance using Google Analytics (GA4) and Google Search Console 

- Prepare simple monthly reports on traffic, engagement, and conversions 

- Coordinate with freelance designers or developers for larger website or SEO projects 



Social & distribution

- Manage posting and engagement on LinkedIn (company and founder accounts) 

- Create simple visuals using Canva and existing brand templates 

- Schedule posts using tools such as Buffer, Metricool, or similar 

- Track performance and optimise posting based on engagement data 

- Marketing operations & reporting

- Maintain marketing assets, templates, and documentation in Notion and Google Drive 

- Assist with marketing automations and lead-tracking between systems 

- Create clear summaries or dashboards for the Head of Growth 

- Identify trends, gaps, or opportunities in content and lead flow 



Experience & skills

- 3+ years’ experience in a marketing coordination or digital marketing role 

- Strong understanding of content marketing and SEO fundamentals 

- Hands-on experience with WordPress (or similar CMS) 

- Experience with
 marketing tools such as ActiveCampaign, Mailchimp, or HubSpot 

- Strong working knowledge of GA4 and Google Search Console 

- Proficient in Canva for light design work 

- Excellent written and verbal English communication 

- Highly organised with strong attention to detail 



Nice to have

- Experience in a B2B, agency, or professional services environment 

- Experience managing writers, designers, or contractors 

- Basic understanding of paid media (Google Ads or LinkedIn Ads)

title: SEO Executive / SEO Strategist (UK Market)
description:
Location: Remote

Experience: 2–5 years

Employment Type: Full-time / Contract (open to discussion)





About the Role



We are looking for an SEO Executive / SEO Strategist who can independently manage end-to-end SEO for multiple clients across UK-based B2B and B2C businesses.



This role goes beyond execution. You will be responsible for strategy, content, performance tracking, and client communication. You will work closely with founders, content writers, and designers while also taking client calls when required to discuss progress, priorities, and results.



If you understand how SEO actually works in the UK market,  not just rankings, but search intent, competition, and commercial outcomes, this role is for you.





Key Responsibilities

SEO Strategy & Planning



Own SEO strategy from discovery to execution for UK-focused clients



Perform keyword research aligned with business intent (B2B & B2C)



Build content roadmaps and SEO plans based on competition and opportunity



Align SEO efforts with commercial goals (leads, enquiries, conversions)



Content & On-Page SEO



Write and/or optimise SEO-focused blog content (UK English)



Ensure content matches search intent, funnel stage, and brand tone



Implement on-page SEO best practices:



Meta titles & descriptions



Heading structures (H1–H3)



Internal linking strategies



Image optimisation & alt tags



Work with writers/editors to maintain consistency and quality



Technical & Off-Page SEO



Identify and coordinate fixes for basic technical SEO issues:



Indexing, crawlability, canonicalisation



Broken links, redirects, page speed (basic understanding)



Support backlink and authority-building strategies where required



Collaborate with developers/designers for SEO-led changes



Tracking, Reporting & Optimisation



Track SEO performance using tools like:



Google Search Console



Google Analytics / GA4



Ahrefs / SEMrush (or equivalent)



Monitor:



Keyword performance



Organic traffic trends



Click-through rates & conversions



Translate data into clear insights and next steps, not just reports



Client Communication



Actively engage with onboarded clients for SEO discussions



Join client calls when required to:



Explain strategy



Discuss progress



Address concerns or feedback



Communicate SEO concepts in a clear, non-technical way to clients





Required Experience & Skills



2–5 years of hands-on SEO experience



Proven experience working with the UK market



Strong understanding of both B2B and B2C SEO



Ability to manage SEO end-to-end without heavy supervision



Excellent written English (UK standard)



Experience writing SEO blogs and long-form content



Comfortable handling client communication and calls



Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset





Nice to Have (Not Mandatory)



Experience in industries like:



Services, logistics, relocation, healthcare, SaaS, or local services



Exposure to international SEO beyond the UK



Familiarity with CMS platforms (WordPress, Webflow, etc.)



Understanding of conversion-led SEO and lead generation





What We Value



Ownership mindset — you take responsibility, not just tasks



Clarity over complexity — practical SEO that drives results



Strong communication — internally and with clients



Ability to prioritise work in a multi-client environment





What We Offer



Remote working with flexible structure



Opportunity to work on high-quality UK clients



Direct exposure to strategy, not just execution



Long-term growth with increasing responsibility



Competitive compensation based on experience



How to Apply



Please share:



Your resume



Examples of SEO projects or websites you’ve worked on



Brief note on your experience with UK SEO and client handling

title: Senior Production Manager (AU Tax Manager)
description:
Why Work With Us?



Salary Above Market



Fixed Weekends Off



Permanent Work From Home



Dayshift



Paid Time Off



With Php 10,000 Sign on bonus (5k on the 3rd month & 5k upon regularization)



HMO



Fun Company Events



A supportive and collaborative client environment



Qualification:



Australian Setting Experience is a Must



Experience Handling a team of Junior to Senior Accountants/Bookkeeper as well as provide training and guidance



Process Individual Returns



experience in preparing the year end financial statements and tax returns in Australian businesses



Able to cover all tax types of  entities being companies, trusts, partnerships, individuals and superfunds. 



Experience in Superannuation Processing, BAS, IAS, Bookkeeping



Xero Practice Manager



Xero/MYOB



Class Super



ATO Portal Experience



With Technical Knowledge in:



Non-commercial loss rule



Division 7A Loans



Individual Tax Claims



Small Business Advice- WorkCover, Stamp Duty, Payroll Tax, FBT



Non-Small Business Advice



CGT SBE Business Concessions



Depreciation rules



CGT Calculation on Sale of Property



SGC obligations



Franking accounts and the dividend imputation system



Family Trust Elections



Completion of Co-invest administration



Taxable Payments Annual Reports



Tax Minimisation Strategies



Responsibilities:



Your major role will be to support your Senior Client Manager in getting the work completed.



You will need to be an expert in the all of these tax and accounting areas as you will need to be able to do the work, delegate and train other staff to do the work and review the work to ensure it is accurate, all tax, accounting and GST issues have been identified and tax strategies have been applied to minimize tax



You will help the less experienced and less qualified team members in completing their tasks and jobs.



You will train and review the work handed to you by your direct reports.



You will train and develop the technical skills of your direct reports helping and teaching them with all aspects of financial statement preparation, taxation return preparation, bookkeeping and payroll processing.



The role includes helping, supporting and training the Assistant Client Manager with all technical knowledge requirements.



Your team will most likely include Senior accountants, Intermediate Accountants, Graduate Accountants, Senior Bookkeepers, Intermediate/Junior Bookkeepers



The position requires you to report to the Senior Client Manager/Director



Your role is to review your teams work and ensure it for quality and have tasks and jobs done to a 90% to 100% completion stage for the Senior Client Manager.



In this regard you will have the ability to complete jobs for the Senior Client Manager and hand them to the Senior Client Manager on a golden platter.



You will be task driven but also have an ability to work with other accountants and bookkeepers, helping and guiding then technically



You will not be required to see clients face to face, but occasionally you will be asked to help your client manager with strategic client meetings, client software selection, business mentoring, strategic tax planning and structuring advice





Technical requirements:

1. Self managed superfunds. Ability to process the final accounts and tax return. Also understand the rules and caps that govern the system and understand what superfunds can and can't do and what needs to be done by when. The rules that govern by the SMSF include the SIS Act and  SIS regulations. Knowledge on how to administer the SMSF. We have had a number of clients go into nursing homes and some have died so this is important as we need to work out the process on what to do next and by when.



2. Individual & partnership tax returns. I would like the candidate to be able to complete these with very minimal supervision and train other staff to do these. This  would require direct contact with the client. Generally it is the capital gains that can be complicated.



3. Companies and trusts - This requires knowledge on generally accounting principals as well as tax. 



4. Software - Ideally knowledge of Xero, Class Xero, ATO portal. Other software includes ATO mate, MYOB, Handisoft and Waive



5. State taxes including Payroll tax, land tax and Workers comp 



6. ASIC - As an ASIC agent we look after our clients company requirements. Ideally the candidate will know how to manage the software "Waive". as well as understand how to update changes as well us setting up and closing new entities. E.g.  Companies, trusts and superfunds

Graphic design: simple assets for stories, promos, drops, announcements (Canva preferred; Adobe is a plus).

Work closely with the founder to keep content aligned with brand energy and launch goals.





What we’re looking for (non-negotiables):



You’ve worked with a fashion/activewear brand before (agency or in-house).

You can think strategically: content pillars, launches, offers, storytelling, and community building.

Strong written English + a natural feel for social tone.

You can edit short-form video (CapCut/Premiere/Rush/InShot, any is fine).

You can design clean, premium-looking graphics (Canva or Adobe).

You’re organised, proactive, and deadline-driven; you don’t wait to be chased.





Bonus points (nice to have):



You understand conversion content: product education, fit/benefits, styling, objections.

Experience working with creators/influencers/UGC.

Paid social familiarity (even at a basic level).

Photography or filming skills.



This is not for you:



If you need step-by-step instructions for every post, this won’t be a fit.

If you’re not comfortable working independently.

If you don’t enjoy thinking creatively and taking initiative

title: Strategic Cold Email Specialist - Campaign Optimization & AI Integration
description:
Role overview

We’re hiring a high-agency Virtual Assistant to own end-to-end cold
 fulfillment for boutique, high-value clients. This is a delivery-first role: you will independently build campaigns from client brief ? live campaign ? optimization, own deliverability and technical reliability, and document SOPs so the owner can step away from day-to-day fulfillment.



Key responsibilities

• Full campaign ownership: intake, client research, ICP definition, lead sourcing, copywriting, workflow build, launch, and optimization.

• Lead sourcing & “5 arbitrages”: identify market geography, lead source, generational targeting, personal brand leverage, and timing to find best-fit prospects. Use Sales Navigator, Apify, custom directories, Google Maps, and other sources.

• Build & maintain automation: create 
 (or n8n) workflows that chain scraping ? enrichment ? AI personalization (Claude/GPT) ? Instantly.ai (sending) ? auto-responders. Train prompts/models for consistent tone.

• AI-driven personalization: use Claude/ChatGPT + structured prompts and examples to generate industry-specific, non-AI-sounding copy at scale. Manage prompt engineering and JSON handling inside 
.

• Deliverability & domain management: domain warmup, sender identities, multi-domain A/B testing, bounce mitigation, NeverBounce validation, and troubleshooting flagged domains.

• Monitoring & optimization: daily checks (reply rates, opens, bounce, domain health), weekly optimizations, A/B tests on subject lines/senders/angles, and proactive fixes.

• Auto-responder & qualification flows: configure AI-assisted reply qualification and automated Calendly booking when qualified.

• SOPs & documentation: produce repeatable playbooks (lead sourcing, copy frameworks by vertical, 
 module templates, campaign optimization playbook, troubleshooting guide).

• Client reporting & communication: weekly performance notes, meeting-ready summaries, and ad-hoc troubleshooting updates.



Required qualifications

• Proven experience building and running cold
 / outbound campaigns end-to-end (not just executing parts).

• Hands-on with: 
 (or comparable automation), Apify (or scraping tools), Sales Navigator, Instantly.ai (or Smartlead), NeverBounce, Claude, and ChatGPT.

• Demonstrable ability to write industry-specific, outcome-focused copy (biotech, recruiting, wealth mgmt., logistics, etc.).

• Experience setting up and troubleshooting multi-domain sending, warmups, and deliverability issues.

• Strong prompt engineering & workflow design skills (training models via 
 JSON prompts).

• Highly organized, proactive, and able to own outcomes with minimal oversight.

• Excellent written & spoken English.



Strong preference/pluses

• Agency or startup experience where you built systems from scratch.

• Proven track record of delivering 15–20 qualified intros in 90 days (or similar meeting-intro guarantees) for clients.

• Experience documenting SOPs and running R&D on new tools.

• Comfortable with advanced scraping sources (government filings, conference lists, directories).

Performance expectations & success metrics

• Consistently hit agreed reply/qualification benchmarks.

• Maintain healthy domain metrics and >3% target reply rates.

• Deliver clear SOPs and handover-ready documentation within the first 60–90 days.

• Owner should be able to step away from day-to-day fulfillment after 90 days.



Compensation & benefits

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses.

Fully remote with EST schedule.

Professional growth: training, career advancement, and real ownership of fulfillment responsibilities.

Paid Time Off for major U.S. holidays.



If you're driven and ready to level up, please apply directly via this link, and we will set up an initial interview schedule for you immediately:

title: TikTok Shop Video Editor (12 Videos Per Day, Same-Day Delivery)
description:
The ideal candidate has proven experience editing short-form vertical videos for TikTok or TikTok Shop and understands how to cut raw footage into fast, engaging videos optimized for pacing, flow, and watch time. This role requires efficiency and speed, as the editor will be responsible for producing 12 videos per day with same-day delivery.



Strong English listening comprehension is required. Much of the raw footage includes multiple takes of the same line, and the editor must be able to clearly understand spoken English in order to confidently choose the best take based on delivery, clarity, and tone without needing step-by-step guidance.



The editor must be comfortable working with UGC-style raw footage and following provided references exactly. This includes using jump cuts, zooms, basic motion, sound effects when appropriate, and adding product images or assets that are provided. No captions or subtitles are required for these edits.



Speed, reliability, and consistency are critical. The current workload of 12 videos typically takes approximately 2–3 hours per day, so the editor must be able to work efficiently while maintaining quality and meeting same-day deadlines.



Technical proficiency with CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar video editing software is required. The editor should also be comfortable exporting videos in TikTok-ready vertical formats and performing basic audio cleanup and leveling when needed.



This role requires someone who can work independently, make good judgment calls, accept feedback, and implement revisions quickly. This is not a beginner position and is intended as a long-term, full-time role for the right candidate.



If you apply please include 2 or 3 examples of your previous work.

title: AI Automation Engineer (Conversational Systems & WhatsApp Automation)
description:

bout the Role

Lead qualification

Human handover

Calendars / booking tools

Message count



AI call frequency



Token usage



Design fallback logic for unexpected or invalid user input



Monitor live automation and prevent failure loops



Treat AI automation as mission-critical operational infrastructure



5. Continuous Improvement

Improve automation accuracy and reduce human workload



Iterate safely without breaking live systems



Scale proven flows across multiple business units



Required Skills & Experience (Must-Have)



Experience building chat or workflow-based automation systems



Strong understanding of conversational flow design



Practical experience deploying LLMs in production



Ability to write controlled, deterministic prompts



Comfortable working with:



JSON



REST APIs



Webhooks



Strong logical thinking and structured problem-solving skills



Strongly Preferred (High Advantage)



Experience with WhatsApp automation or messaging platforms



Background in sales, customer service, or operational automation



Experience optimising AI usage for cost and performance



Python or Node.js



Experience owning systems where uptime and accuracy matter

title: Faceless Youtube Content
description:
We are seeking a skilled Video Editor to produce 6–10 minute documentary-style videos for a faceless YouTube channel. The content focuses on narrative-driven true stories regarding the extreme measures individuals take for financial gain.

Job Duties:

Visual Storytelling: Assemble a compelling visual narrative using a combination of high-quality stock footage, archival news clips, and AI-generated imagery.

Pacing & Sequencing: Execute precise cuts and transitions to maintain high viewer retention and build suspense throughout the 6–10 minute runtime.

Audio Integration: Synchronize provided voiceover tracks with appropriate cinematic background music and immersive sound effects (SFX).

Text & Graphics: Implement dynamic on-screen captions and basic motion graphics to highlight key data points or dramatic moments.

Quality Control: Ensure all final renders meet YouTube’s technical standards for 4K/1080p resolution and clear audio balancing.



Frequency: 2 videos per week.

title: Virtual Assistant / Video Editor
description:
Job Posting: Virtual Assistant/Video Editor for YouTube Project

Hello!

I’m looking for a loyal, reliable, and talented Virtual Assistant/Video Editor for an exciting new YouTube project I’m launching.

Project Description:

You will serve as my personal assistant, handling video editing and various administrative tasks to help run the channel smoothly. This is more than just a freelance gig—I’m looking for someone who wants to grow with me and become my right hand for the long haul. It will be just you and me working together closely.

The editor will be responsible for assembling full videos using online visual assets that support and explain the narration. The emphasis is on clarity, flow, and storytelling—not heavy effects or complex animations.

Key Responsibilities:

 ? Video Editing: Craft compelling narratives through strategic pacing and clip selection that keep viewers engaged from start to finish

 ? Visual Enhancements: Add relevant graphics, text overlays, and smooth transitions that enhance the viewing experience while aligning with the channel’s aesthetic

How to Apply:

 1. Send your resume to:

 3. Include in your
:

Thank you for your time and consideration—I look forward to building something great together!

title: Job Application Specialist / Virtual Assistant (applying to jobs)
description:
We’re hiring an application specialist to apply to jobs and contract opportunities.



This is not an entry level role.



You must already have real, hands on experience successfully applying to roles for another client and producing interviews, callbacks, or offers.



If you have not done this before for a real client, please do not apply.



Your job is to find relevant roles and submit accurate, well matched applications using approved materials and process.



Accuracy and judgment matter more than volume.



You will:

Find relevant job and contract opportunities that clearly match the client’s background

Review each role carefully before applying

Customize small parts of applications when needed using approved notes and templates

Submit applications using the client’s resume, profile, and materials

Track every application in a shared sheet

Flag high quality or unusual opportunities for review

You will only use approved information and materials.

You must never create fake profiles or misrepresent experience.



We will provide:

The client’s resume and background

Positioning and short intro messages

Approved templates and examples

A clear step by step system

You will not be guessing.



Mandatory experience

To be considered, you must have:

Prior success applying to jobs or freelance roles for another client

Proof that your past work resulted in interviews, replies, or qualified leads

Experience working independently without needing daily supervision





Required skills:



Strong written English

Extremely high attention to detail

Very comfortable using job platforms and application forms

Able to follow instructions exactly

Strong personal organization and tracking habits



Nice to have:

Experience applying for roles in consulting, marketing, tech, or agency environments

Experience using LinkedIn and major job boards

Experience supporting founders, consultants, or agencies



Hours and schedule

Part time to start

Around 10 to 20 hours per week

Long term role if performance is strong



Pay

Please include your hourly rate in your application.

Important note



How to apply



Please include:

1. A short description of the client you previously supported and what types of roles you applied for

2. A brief example of results you achieved (interviews, replies, shortlists, etc.)

3. Your weekly availability and hourly rate

title: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT /  CLIENT SUCCESS & OPERATIONS COORDINATOR
description:
Are you the motivated and resourceful Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator we are looking for?

Do you love organising, supporting clients, and keeping operations running smoothly? Are you confident with digital tools, proactive with communication, and quick to learn new systems?



If you’re someone who thrives on structure, loves helping others succeed, and enjoys being the organised backbone of a growing digital agency, then this might be the perfect role for you.



Milkyway is a digital agency helping businesses grow through strategy, branding, websites, content, and digital marketing. We partner closely with our clients, and exceptional communication and organisation are at the heart of how we deliver our services.



We’re expanding, and we’re looking for a Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator to join our team.



ABOUT YOU

The ideal person wants to grow with us, bring structure to our operations, and help create a world-class client experience.

You are:

• Smart, fast, confident, and exceptionally organised.

• Able to manage calendars, appointments, and workflows with precision.

• A strong communicator who writes clearly and professionally.

• Comfortable supporting clients and answering their questions with care.

• Accountable, reliable, and always on top of follow-through.

• Proactive and resourceful, able to anticipate needs and solve problems early.

• Calm under pressure and adaptable when priorities shift.

• A lightning-fast learner who enjoys mastering new systems.

• Familiar with tools like Google Workspace, Zoom, GHL (GoHighLevel), WordPress, Click-up and Canva.

• Experienced in handling online communication and digital admin tasks.

• Someone who genuinely enjoys helping clients and supporting a team.

• If you are highly organised, love supporting others, and want to work in a digital-first environment, you’ll excel in this role.



ABOUT THE ROLE

The Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator reports directly to the agency owner and works closely with the delivery team.



You will:

• Be the first point of contact for clients, responding to messages, bookings, and questions within one business day.

• Organise the owner’s calendar, schedule meetings, and prepare notes, agendas, and follow-up actions

• Support the sales process by managing enquiries, booking discovery calls, and sending pre- and post-call communications.

• Prepare and send client reports accurately and on time.

• Manage and update workflows, pipelines, and automations inside GHL (GoHighLevel).

• Complete basic WordPress tasks, including content updates and minor maintenance (escalating anything complex to the webdev/designer).

• Assist with client onboarding, follow-up communication, and ongoing support.

• Helping the project manager organise tasks and deadlines on the project management tool. 

• Create simple Canva assets when needed for client updates or internal use.

• Keep internal processes organised and up to date to support smooth operations.

• Ensure clients feel supported, informed, and taken care of at all times.



This is a remote position, ideally operating within or close to Australian (Brisbane) business hours.

We are looking for someone who wants to be part of a growing team and contribute meaningfully to the success of our clients and operations. It must be a definite yes from both sides.



WHAT YOU’LL GET WHEN YOU JOIN MILKYWAY

A supportive, growth-focused environment where your ideas and organisational strengths make a real difference.

You’ll enjoy:



• A positive and collaborative team culture.

• Clear processes and expectations designed to set you up for success.

• Training and onboarding to help you confidently step into the role.

• Opportunities to grow professionally in client success, operations, and digital systems.

• Flexibility and autonomy in your work, with trust from day one.

• Exposure to a wide range of digital tools and modern agency systems.

• We believe in empowering both our clients and our team. When you thrive, so do we.



HOW TO APPLY

Click the link to apply and include a phrase containing “Stardust” in the final section 

of the application form so we know you read this ad in full.




kywaydigital.agency/ops-va



If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this opportunity with them.

title: Remote Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
At Bloomer Estates Vacation Rentals, we don’t just manage properties—we create unforgettable guest experiences on the beautiful Washington coast. For over 20 years, we’ve grown into one of the region’s most trusted and well-loved vacation rental companies, now managing nearly 100 unique properties. Our success comes from a mix of innovation, exceptional service, and a team that’s passionate about hospitality.



Our founder spent 18 years at Microsoft, and that background drives our commitment to using the best software and technologies to run our business efficiently and stay ahead of industry trends. Now, we are bringing that same technology-first mindset to our marketing—leveraging cutting-edge tools, including AI, to deliver smarter, more personalized campaigns and optimize every aspect of guest engagement.



We are proud to be a locally owned, forward-thinking company that empowers our tea
mbers with the autonomy to create and innovate. When you join Bloomer Estates, you’re not just taking a job—you’re helping shape the future of a growing brand that thrives on creativity, technology, and collaboration.



Job Summary



We are seeking a creative, data-driven Remote Digital Marketing Specialist to lead our digital initiatives. The primary focus of this role is designing and executing AI-driven
 marketing campaigns that segment and target our guest database with personalized, automated messages—maximizing repeat bookings and guest engagement. You will also manage content creation, SEO, social media, and paid campaigns to elevate our online presence and drive direct revenue growth.



Key Responsibilities



 Marketing 



--Lead the development and execution of AI-driven
 campaigns tailored to guest demographics and booking history.



---Use segmentation, automation, and personalization to increase engagement and repeat bookings.



--Continuously test, analyze, and optimize
 campaigns for improved performance.



Digital Campaigns & Content



---Plan and execute multi-channel digital marketing strategies to increase direct bookings and boost brand visibility.



---Create engaging, on-brand content for social media platforms 
, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.).



---Produce compelling blog posts, landing pages, and promotional content aligned with our marketing goals.



SEO & Analytics



---Optimize website content and property listings for improved organic search performance.



---Use Google Analytics and social media insights to measure campaign effectiveness and adjust strategies accordingly.



Paid Advertising & Outreach



---Manage and refine paid advertising campaigns (Google Ads,
 Ads, etc.) to maximize ROI.



---Collaborate with influencers, bloggers, and travel platforms to expand brand reach.



Brand Management



---Ensure brand consistency across all digital channels and communications.



---Monitor industry trends and competitor strategies to stay ahead in the vacation rental market.



Qualifications & Skills



---5+ years of experience in digital marketing, preferably in vacation rentals, hospitality, or travel.



---Proven expertise in
 marketing (segmentation, automation, and AI-driven personalization).



---Proficiency with Google Analytics, Google Ads, Meta Business Suite, and
 marketing platforms.



---Strong knowledge of SEO and content optimization.



---Graphic design skills (Canva, Adobe Suite, or similar).



---Excellent writing and communication skills.



---Highly organized, self-motivated, and able to thrive in a remote work environment.



---Portfolio of prior work is required 
 campaigns, content samples, ads, or similar). Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Benefits



---Competitive salary (negotiable based on experience).



---Flexible schedule in a fully remote role.



---High level of autonomy with the freedom to design and execute creative campaigns.



---Opportunity to make a direct impact on the growth of a well-established and rapidly expanding vacation rental company.

title: E-Commerce Growth Manager (Full-Time, High-Performance Role)
description:
About Us



We’re a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990, now entering an exciting new growth phase.



Our brands — Plastair (innovative watering products), DeeVa (personal wellness & therapeutic devices), and PlastairFyre (outdoor fireplaces) — are Made in Canada and distributed across North America.



We’ve dominated brick-and-mortar retail for years. Now we’re scaling our Direct-to-Consumer (B2C) division to millions in annual sales.



We’re looking for a leader who’s ready to take ownership of that transformation.



The Role



This is not a VA position — this is a management-level role with room to grow into Director of E-Commerce.



You will:



Build and lead a small team (ads, creatives, and content support).



Develop and execute strategies across Amazon US/CA/UK/EU/Asia, Shopify, 
, and Wayfair.



Manage ad budgets, track performance, and ensure ROI targets are met.



Coordinate promotions, influencer partnerships, and content creation.



Report directly to ownership and take responsibility for results.



This role is ideal for a self-driven e-commerce professional in their late 20s to early 30s who’s ready to step up and run a division, not just accounts.



Your Responsibilities



Create a comprehensive global e-commerce strategy and action plan.



Hire, train, and manage 2–4 tea
mbers (VA or specialized roles).



Manage Amazon and Meta ad campaigns and continuously optimize ROI.



Oversee product listings, images, and A + content for all marketplaces.



Coordinate with our graphics, photo, and video team to improve digital assets.



Build influencer and affiliate relationships.



Analyze weekly reports, identify growth opportunities, and make fast, data-driven decisions.



Own results — think and act like it’s your business line.



Key Performance Targets



Amazon ACOS < 15 %



Meta ROAS > 6 ×



Launch 
 and Wayfair within 3 months.



Expand into 2 new Amazon markets within 6 months.



Achieve a 400 % increase in B2C revenue by 2026 while maintaining gross margins > 30 %.



You’ll Succeed If You



Have 3 + years of e-commerce experience, including team or campaign management.



Have launched or managed multiple Amazon or Shopify brands.



Are comfortable hiring and leading others.



Communicate fluently in English and can coordinate with North American teams.



Are entrepreneurial, analytical, and thrive on responsibility.



Can overlap 2–3 hours daily with Eastern Time.



Are ready to work full-time and fully commit to one company’s success.



How to Apply



Send:

1?? Your résumé showing your e-commerce and leadership experience.

2?? A detailed 200-word action plan outlining how you would grow Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre online within your first 90 days.

We expect candidates to research our existing brands, products, and current online presence before writing their plan. Generic or copy-paste responses will not be considered.

3?? Links to brands or campaigns you’ve managed + specific results.

title: Senior PLC Programmer
description:
Hello,



We are currently looking for a skilled PLC programmer to support an important automation project at FirstBlock.



We have a large existing control system developed in Siemens TIA Portal that needs to be professionally migrated to CODESYS on a WAGO PLC platform. The system includes approximately 100 I/O points (DI, DO, AI, AO) and two PID control loops.



This project requires strong expertise in:



Industrial automation



PLC programming (Ladder / Structured Text)



System migration and optimization



Commissioning and documentation



Once this main project is completed, we expect to have ongoing and recurring PLC work, offering long-term collaboration opportunities for the right candidate.



We are looking for someone who is:



Reliable and detail-oriented



Experienced in industrial environments



Able to deliver clean, structured, and maintainable code



Comfortable working independently



If you are interested in collaborating with a growing engineering company on high-quality automation projects, we would be pleased to hear from you.



Please contact us with your experience, availability, and portfolio.



Best regards,

FirstBlock Engineering Team
