title: Highly Organised Administrative Assistant
description:
About the Role

We’re a growing YouTube channel that produces long-form true crime content using real documents, bodycam footage, and police interrogations.



We are looking for a FOIA Requester (Freedom of Information Act Requester) to help us obtain police records and video footage from agencies across the United States. You will be the one finding cases, filing requests, tracking responses, and organizing the material so our team can turn it into high-quality documentaries.



This is a long-term, stable role for someone who loves systems, organization, and—most importantly—true crime.



IMPORTANT – TRUE CRIME FANS ONLY

We are only hiring true crime fans.

In your application, you must answer these:

What is your favorite type of true crime content to watch?

Share one specific case, series, or channel you enjoy and why.

Applications without these answers will not be considered.



Key Responsibilities

Research interesting i
 and cases (using news articles, court records, etc.) that could be good for video content.

Draft, submit, and follow up on FOIA / public records requests to police departments, sheriff’s offices, and other government agencies in the US.

Track all requests in spreadsheets .

Download, organize, and neatly label all returned files (videos, audio, documents) in Google Drive.

Filter out low-value or irrelevant cases and make initial judgment calls on whether something is worth pursuing further.

Communicate with agencies by
 and sometimes by phone (if needed) in clear, professional English.

Prepare short summaries of received materials so the team understands what we got.

Follow written SOPs step-by-step and suggest improvements when you see inefficiencies.



Required Skills & Qualities

You genuinely enjoy true crime content.

Strong written English – you’ll be
ing government agencies and reading official documents.

Highly organized – you live in Google Sheets / spreadsheets without getting overwhelmed.

Detail-oriented – you notice small inconsistencies, dates, names, and file labels.

Process-driven – you can follow SOPs exactly, but also give feedback to improve them.

Good judgment – you can d
 if a case is interesting, unique, and worth
.

Research skills – comfortable digging through news articles, public records, and websites to find information.

Tech-comfortable – using Google Drive, Google Sheets, Gmail, and basic video/file download tools.



Nice-to-Have (Not Required, but a Plus)

Any experience with FOIA, public records requests, legal research, or working with US-based clients.

Experience working with true crime channels, journalism, or content research.

Familiarity with tools like Trello, Notion, or other task/project systems.

Experience summarizing or organizing large amounts of information.



Content Warning

This job involves dealing with real crimes: violence, murder, and disturbing situations.

Please only apply if you are mentally and emotionally comfortable working with this type of material on a daily basis.



Hours & Compensation

Hours: Part-time (20 hours/week) with the opportunity to grow into full-time if it is a good fit

Schedule: Flexible, but you must be reachable during agreed working hours and keep your tasks up to date.



Long-term, stable work with the opportunity to grow as the channel expands.



To Apply

Complete the below IQ test and screenshot your result, include the result link in your application.


/

Send: relevant experience, availability/timezone.

Include your IQ number in the first line of your application, and include your favorite true crime YouTube channel in your application, or your application will not be considered.

Example channel:

- Native English speaker with a strong command of tone, pacing, and language

- Can identify the most compelling 
nts from hours of real interrogation footage

title: Experienced Customer Service Representative (E-commerce / Dropshipping)
description:
We are looking for a highly experienced Customer Service Representative to support our growing dropshipping e-commerce brands.



This role is not for beginners. We are specifically looking for someone who already understands how customer support works in e-commerce and can operate independently from day one.



Your main responsibility will be handling customer
 support efficiently and professionally. If we are a good match after 2–4 weeks, this role can expand into a full-time position with more responsibility, including managing disputes and overseeing other customer service representatives.



Key Responsibilities



Responding to customer support
s professionally and efficiently



Handling Shopify customer inquiries (orders, shipping, refunds, issues)



Managing and responding to PayPal and Klarna disputes correctly and on time



Using Slack for internal communication with the team



Following brand tone, policies, and procedures accurately



Reducing chargebacks and disputes through proper communication



(Future role) Managing disputes end-to-end and supervising other CS reps



Requirements



Proven experience in e-commerce / dropshipping customer service



Strong experience with Shopify,
 support, and Slack



Hands-on experience handling PayPal and Klarna disputes



Excellent written English



Ability to work EU time zone hours



Organized, reliable, and able to work independently



Knows what to say, how to say it, and when to escalate issues



Schedule



Starts Part-Time



Working hours aligned with the EU time zone



Opportunity to move to Full-Time after 2–4 weeks based on performance



Why Work With Us



Clear processes and expectations



Long-term opportunity for the right person



Role growth into a managing position if you prove to be a strong fit



Direct impact on improving customer experience and reducing disputes



To Apply

Please apply only if you have real experience in e-commerce customer service and dispute handling. We are looking for someone who can add immediate value to our customer support operations.

title: Office Sales Manager – Promotional Products or Similar
description:
Full-Time or Part-Time (4hr or 7hr) Between 9AM to 6PM - New York Eastern Time



Our printing and promotional products company is looking to add a professional, experienced Office Sales Manager to our successful team.

Only candidates with promotional products industry experience will be considered.



We design and produce a wide range of advertising materials for companies, retail stores, national chains, wholesalers, and corporations.



Responsibilities



Execute an aggressive daily outreach and follow-up plan using CRM software (Commonsku or ESP or SAGE) to generate new business opportunities with both prospects and existing clients.



Document all activity in the CRM and prepare weekly sales activity reports with projected results.



Expand and qualify the prospect list through phone outreach, internet research, networking, and other lead sources.



Maintain and grow relationships with current clients to secure repeat and increased orders.



Consistently achieve sales goals by building rapport, following up, developing proposals, presenting solutions, and overcoming objections.



Assist in developing and implementing innovative marketing plans to support sales growth. Extra duties for office manager.



Skills, Knowledge & Abilities



Experience in the promotional products industry is required.



Bachelor’s degree preferred; some college coursework accepted.



Strong cold-calling ability with skill in reaching decision-makers, building relationships, and closing sales.



Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.



Verified track record of exceeding sales goals.



Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and CRM software.



Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.



Ability to maintain strong working relationships with coworkers and vendors.



Requirements



2+ years of national sales experience.



Strong communication skills to sell effectively to decision-makers at all levels.



Proven success selling promotional products to corporate clients.



Compensation



We offer a competitive base salary, sales commission, monthly bonuses, and additional incentives.



If you are a true promotional products sales professional with the ability to close deals, we want to hear from you!



Please
 your resume and cover letter to apply.

Join our team and share in the growth and success of our company.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We’re Hiring at BOUNDLESS COLLECTIVE!



Who We Are

Boundless Collective is a dynamic, experienced outsourcing powerhouse specializing in delivering creative, admin-backed solutions across industries. We’re not just assistants, we’re innovators, growth enablers, and trusted partners in our clients’ success.



Why You’ll Love It Here

- A high-energy team culture that blends professionalism with camaraderie, where collaboration and creativity are daily drivers.

- Fun-focused atmosphere: from team outings and social events to celebrating milestones big and small, work here feels like more than just work.

- Meaningful recognition: enjoy structured bonuses and reward programs that celebrate your contributions and let you know they’re appreciated.

- Growth-first mindset: as part of our team, you’ll innovate, share ideas, and help shape the future of client solutions every single day.



We’re expanding, and we’re looking for talented individuals to be part of our dynamic team! If you're looking for a fulfilling, impactful role, read on to see how you can contribute and grow with us!



We are hiring for the following positions:



Executive Assistant



What We Offer:

Position: Full-time

Work Setup: Permanent remote – work from anywhere in the world!

Shift: 7 AM - 4 PM (MNL time) – Start your day with energy!

Equipment: Self-provided – Bring your tech, and we’ll bring the opportunity!

Salary: up to PHP 30,000 depending on experience. + bonuses



Apply via this link: 
/
RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.
 & Inbox Management

- Organise and manage multiple
 inboxes

- Write
s and communications on behalf of the client (client reviews before sending)

- Draft, reply, and escalate communications appropriately

- Ensure timely follow-ups and flag priority items



2. Scheduling & Calendar Management

- Book and manage meetings, calls, and follow-ups

- Send reminders and calendar invites; handle reschedules smoothly

- Coordinate across time zones when required



3. CRM Management

- Input and update contacts, notes, and opportunities

- Track follow-ups and maintain strong pipeline hygiene

- Extract basic reports as needed 



4. Content Management (Ferns Finance)

, YouTube, TikTok, Threads, X, etc.

- Use Airtable to post to Webflow, and Rella to post to the above-mentioned social channels

QUALIFICATIONS:

- 2–3 years’ experience as an Executive Assistant, Administrative Assistant, Operations Support, or similar role

- Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with a professional, client-first approach

- Highly organised with strong attention to detail and ability to manage competing priorities

- Confident managing multiple inboxes, stakeholders, and follow-ups

- Comfortable with calendar management, scheduling across time zones, and coordinating meetings end-to-end

- Experience using CRM systems to update contacts, notes, and opportunities, and maintain strong follow-up processes

Nice to Have

- Experience scheduling, tracking tasks, and maintaining workflow systems (e.g., Asana, ClickUp, Trello, Notion, Monday)

- Canva experience and basic video editing capability

- Experience using social scheduling/posting tools (e.g., Rella or similar)

- Comfortable drafting short-form content from provided updates/guidelines (e.g., articles, insight posts)



At Boundless Collective, we take pride in fostering a culture of confidence, reliability, and a relentless commitment to excellence. If you are ready to support a dynamic executive team and grow in a supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Ready to make an impact and elevate your career? Apply via link below and let's create something extraordinary together!



APPLY HERE:

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
We are looking for a creative specialist to lead our social media activity across multiple brands.

Must be good with design tools (Adobe Suite, Canva), with an enthusiastic understanding of marketing fundamentals (competitive research, brand positioning, value proposition etc…), and the ability to bring it all together to make engaging social media campaigns (strategy, storytelling).



This role will be an interesting mix of research, strategy, design, analysis, and interaction across all social media accounts.

We are looking for an active social media user that can spot relevant content trends and use these insights to create engaging content for our brands/channels.



Company Overview: OneWorld Business Solutions is a consulting firm dedicated to helping small and medium-sized companies optimise their operations and streamline processes to drive growth and success.



Responsibilities:

-Plan, generate, edit, publish, and share daily content that builds meaningful connections and encourages community members to take action.

-Set up and optimize company pages within each platform to increase the visibility of the company’s social content.

-Ensure that all published content is consistent with the brand image and positioning

-Continuously improve by capturing and analyzing the appropriate social data/metrics, insights, and best practices, and then acting on the information.

-Collaborate with other departments (customer relations, sales, etc.) to manage reputation, identify key players, and coordinate actions.



Requirements:

-Proven working experience in social media marketing or as a digital media specialist.

-Excellent consulting, writing, editing (photo/video/text), presentation, and communication skills.

-Experience working in the finance sector is a huge advantage

-Demonstrable social networking experience and social analytics tools knowledge.

-Knowledge of online marketing and a good understanding of major marketing channels.

-Positive attitude, detail and customer-oriented with good multitasking and organizational ability. (If you’ve read this far, include the word “pineapple” in your application—we like to work with people who pay attention to detail)

-Fluency in English.



What We Offer:

-Competitive salary package.

-Opportunities for professional growth and development.

-A dynamic and supportive work environment.

title: VIRTUAL EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT
description:
About Us

Unbound Minds Psychology is one of Western Sydney’s fastest-growing psychology practices. We operate across two locations with 32+ practitioners, specialising in autism, ADHD, and behavioural assessments for children, adolescents, and adults. We values culture, clinical excellence, and sustainable growth.

We’re looking for a sharp, reliable, and proactive Virtual Executive Assistant to support our CEO and CCO directly. This is not a generic VA role - you’ll be embedded in the operations of a real healthcare business and trusted with meaningful work from day one.



The Role

You’ll work directly with the CEO and CCO across a mix of administrative, marketing, and operational tasks. This role will grow as the business grows. We’re starting at 20 hours per week with a clear path to full-time for the right person.



Core Responsibilities

Admin & Operations

• Chase overdue invoices and follow up on outstanding payments

• Manage appointment scheduling in our practice management system (Zanda)

• Maintain and update spreadsheets, trackers, and internal documents

Marketing & Content

• Schedule and post social media content across Instagram,
, and LinkedIn using pre-approved templates and copy

• Basic Canva design work (resizing, minor edits to branded templates)

• Assist with
 marketing campaigns (GoHighLevel or similar CRM)

Reporting & Research

• Compile weekly reports on key metrics (as directed - you will not have access to all financial data)

• Research tasks as needed (competitor analysis, supplier comparisons, venue sourcing, etc.)

• Assist with preparing documents, proposals, and presentations



What We’re Looking For

Must-Haves

• Minimum 2 years experience as a VA or EA supporting a founder, CEO, or senior executive

• Excellent written and spoken English - you’ll be drafting
s and communicating with Australian professionals

• Strong attention to detail (we will test this during the application process)

• Experience with scheduling, invoicing, and CRM tools (specific training on our systems will be provided)

• Proficiency in Office 365, Canva, and social media scheduling tools

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional workspace

• Available to work during Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST) hours, or with significant overlap



Nice-to-Haves

• Experience supporting a healthcare or allied health business

• Familiarity with Australian healthcare systems (Medicare, NDIS)

• Experience with GoHighLevel, Zanda, or similar practice management software

• Basic understanding of
 Ads Manager and Google Ads (reporting level, not campaign management)

• Experience with Trainual or similar SOP/training platforms



What You’ll Get

• Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)

• Direct access to the CEO - not a middle manager, not a team of 50. You’ll work closely with the decision-maker

• A clear path to full-time hours as the business grows

• Structured onboarding with SOPs and training

• A genuine, values-driven workplace that treats people like humans, not headcount

• Exposure to a fast-growing healthcare business across clinical operations, marketing, HR, and strategy



How to Apply

Do NOT just send a resume. Applications without the following will not be considered:

1. A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself. Tell us: who you are, who you’ve supported before, what tools you use daily, and why this role interests you.

2. Your updated resume/CV.

3. In the subject line of your application, include the word “Mindset” so we know you’ve read this entire ad.



Our Screening Process

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a short paid test task before a final Zoom interview. We respect your time and compensate for all test work. We’re hiring one person and investing in them for the long term - so we take this process seriously.



Important: This role involves access to sensitive business and client scheduling data in a healthcare setting. You will be required to sign a confidentiality agreement and adhere to Australian privacy standards. We take data security seriously and will provide full training on our requirements.



We’re building something special. If you want to be part of it, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Creative Graphic Designer
description:
HIRING: Creative Graphic Designer (Freelance / Per Deliverable Basis)



We’re looking for a highly creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer who can bring ideas to life through engaging visual and video content. This freelance role is perfect for someone who thrives on creative variety — working across marketing campaigns, social media, digital assets, and short-form video edits.



 You’ll enjoy flexible hours and a paid-per-design model, where rates vary depending on the complexity of each task.



Scope of Work:

You’ll create content such as:

- Social media posts and carousel designs

- Digital marketing materials and branded assets

- Flyers, posters, and presentation decks

-
 layouts and website graphics

- Short-form videos (e.g., Reels or storytelling edits)

*** Projects will follow established brand guidelines and creative briefs, ensuring a consistent and professional visual identity.



Core Skills Required:

We’re looking for someone who is:

- Proficient in Photoshop, Illustrator, and Canva

- Skilled in video editing (Premiere Pro, CapCut, or After Effects)

- Experienced in creating short-form video content for social media

- Familiar with layout design, branding, and typography

- Reliable with strong attention to detail and time management

???? Bonus: Experience working with multiple brands or creative agencies is an advantage.



Payment Model:

- Paid per approved deliverable

- Rate depends on the complexity and scope of each task

- All tasks are clearly tagged and tracked in ClickUp

- Consistent, high-quality output may lead to higher rates or retainer opportunities



Deliverables:

- Each approved task must include:

- Editable source files (PSD, Canva, or video project files)

- Final exports (PNG, PDF, or MP4)

- Folder containing any fonts, icons, or clips used

- Uploaded to the assigned cloud folder and linked to the project task

- All completed designs become the intellectual property of the company upon payment.



Turnaround & Revisions:

- Standard turnaround: 48–72 hours per task

- Up to 2 revision rounds included

- Rush jobs ((<24 hours) may include an additional surcharge

On-time, high-quality submissions may qualify for performance bonuses

Workflow & Collaboration

All tasks and feedback are managed through ClickUp, with clear briefs, deadlines, and file upload instructions.

 Strong communication, initiative, and creative collaboration are essential.

Trial & Growth

This role begins with a 4-week trial period, where performance will be reviewed based on:

Quality and creativity of deliverables

Timeliness and responsiveness

Fit within the team and workflow

Successful creatives may transition to ongoing or project-based contracts.



?? How to Apply

Please apply thru this link:

title: Digital Marketing Strategist
description:
Digital Marketing Strategist (Part-Time, Remote – Offshore)



Join a purpose-driven team supporting NDIS providers nationwide



About Us

Sync Assist is a growing Australian-based virtual assistant and digital systems agency specialising in supporting NDIS providers with admin, marketing, and automation solutions.



We’re expanding our marketing division and seeking a Digital Marketing Strategist to take the lead in shaping and driving the marketing direction of Sync Assist, our founder’s mentorship brand, and our client projects.

This is a hands-on strategic role, perfect for a creative thinker who understands data, direction, and delivery.



The Opportunity

You’ll be responsible for developing and executing digital marketing strategies that grow brand awareness, generate leads, and deliver consistent results for both internal brands and our clients.

You’ll lead our offshore marketing team to ensure projects are executed efficiently, aligned with brand strategy, and informed by data.



Key Responsibilities:

Brand & Strategy

 *Develop and refine marketing strategies for Sync Assist, mentorship, and client brands.

 *Build monthly content plans and campaign calendars aligned with each brand’s goals.

 *Oversee brand consistency across all digital platforms.



Campaign Execution

 *Create and manage social media strategies,
 campaigns, and digital funnels.

 *Use analytics to evaluate performance and make data-driven adjustments.

 *Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure deliverables meet brand and quality standards.



Team Leadership

 *Lead, brief, and manage the marketing team through clear task direction and project deadlines.

 *Oversee the quality of all marketing outputs, ensuring on-time delivery and alignment with strategy.

 *Foster creativity, collaboration, and accountability within the team.



Client Service Delivery

 *Translate client goals into clear marketing plans and content strategies.

 *Oversee the execution of client service packages — from setup to ongoing campaign management.

 *Report on performance metrics and outcomes to improve results and retention.



Key Requirements

Proven experience in digital marketing strategy and team leadership (agency or service-based experience preferred).

Strong understanding of social media strategy, content planning, and brand positioning.

Experience with marketing analytics (Google Analytics, Meta Insights, etc.) and using data to adjust campaigns.

Working knowledge of ClickUp (or similar project management platforms).

Familiarity with Go High Level (GHL) or CRM automation tools is highly regarded.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

Strong sense of initiative, ownership, and accountability.

Desirable (But Not Mandatory)

Hands-on creative skills in post design, reel creation, video editing, and caption writing.

Experience managing content in Canva or similar design platforms.

Basic copywriting and storytelling ability for social media content.



Ideal Candidate Traits

You are:

A strategic thinker who thrives on structure and data.

Confident in leading creatives and content implementers.

Able to translate reports and insights into actionable improvements.

Passionate about helping small businesses and service providers grow online.

Comfortable working autonomously within an offshore team environment.



Role Details

Type: Part-time (20–25 hours/week to start)

Location: Remote (Offshore)

Schedule: Flexible hours with overlap during Australian business hours

Reports To: Founder & Operations Manager



Please submit your application through this link: 



All job applications submitted outside of the provided link will not be considered.

title: Sales & Operations Support Coordinator (Remote – Philippines)
description:
We are looking for an exceptional Offshore Admin / Operations Support Specialist based in the Philippines to support our Australian operations.



This is a key role that blends sales support, estimating admin, job management paperwork, and reporting. You’ll work closely with our internal team and will regularly communicate with field staff, our Operations Manager, and clients to gather information and keep jobs moving.



We are happy to pay towards the higher end of the market for the right person — we’re looking for top talent.



Key Responsibilities



You will support the team across sales, estimating, and job administration, including:



Sales and estimating support (admin + coordination)



Following up job paperwork and customer documentation



Job management admin including:



data entry



job setup



job updates



internal coordination



Consulting with stakeholders to gather missing information, including:



field staff / technicians



our Operations Manager



clients and customers



Maintaining accurate job information inside our job management software



Preparing and updating job cost reports



Supporting job cost analysis and identifying cost issues early



Assisting with process improvement and keeping workflows consistent



What We’re Looking For



This role suits someone who is both highly organised and confident with communication — someone who can handle admin tasks, but also speak comfortably with different people and get the info needed.



You should have:



Strong written and spoken English (essential)



Confident communication skills 
 + phone/Zoom)



Comfort communicating with a wide range of stakeholders:



internal tea
mbers



field staff



management



clients/customers



Ideally, a background in sales support, customer service, or sales admin



Proven experience with:



process management



structured admin workflows



accurate data entry



Strong analytical skills and comfort working with reports, job costing, and numbers



A history of being reliable, proactive, and detail-focused



Skills That Will Help You Succeed



Experience using job management software (any system is fine — training provided)



Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills



Ability to manage multiple tasks without losing accuracy



Comfortable following processes AND improving them when needed



Work Setup



Remote, home-based (Philippines)



Long-term role for the right person



Training and clear processes provided



You will work closely with an Australian team



Compensation



We are happy to offer high-end market pay for the right candidate.

We’re not looking for the cheapest — we want the best.

title: Link Building Specialist (Blog Commenting)
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Link Building Specialist to build backlinks through blog commenting across multiple websites. This is a straightforward, process-driven role — you will be provided with spreadsheets containing exact anchor text, target keywords, and clear instructions on how to find relevant blogs for comment placement.



If you are organized, can follow directions closely, and have experience with blog commenting for SEO, this is a great fit for you.



What You'll Be Doing:



- Build 3–5 backlinks per day per website through blog commenting

- Follow provided spreadsheets with assigned anchor text, keywords, and target URLs

- Find relevant, high-quality blogs using our provided research instructions

- Write thoughtful, natural-sounding blog comments that don't look spammy

- Manage link building across multiple websites simultaneously

- Track and report all completed links daily, including live comment URLs, anchor text used, and blog details

- Ensure comments are approved and links remain live



Requirements:



- Experience with blog commenting as a link building strategy

- Ability to write relevant, genuine-sounding comments in English that add value to the blog post (no generic or spammy comments)

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail

- Able to follow step-by-step instructions consistently

- Comfortable managing multiple websites and spreadsheets at the same time

- Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision

- Reliable internet connection



Nice to Have:



- Familiarity with SEO concepts such as domain authority, dofollow vs. nofollow links, and anchor text optimization

- Experience using tools like Ahrefs, SEMrush, or Moz to evaluate blog quality

- Previous experience building links for multiple clients or an agency



Compensation:



- Pay is performance-based and calculated weekly based on the number of verified, live backlinks built

- Rate per link will be discussed during the interview

- Payment issued weekly



How to Apply:



Please include the following in your application:



1. A brief summary of your experience with blog commenting for link building

2. Examples of blog comments you have placed with live links (if available)

3. How many blog comment links you can realistically build per day

4. Confirm that you read the full job posting by adding this keyword in your application: "Lake Como"

4. Your expected rate per backlink



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Finance & Accounting - Full time
description:
URGENT HIRING!



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are looking for a Senior Finance Executive who can fully commit with us. This role requires hands-on involvement in finance and accounting tasks and close coordination with internal departments and external stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities:

- Conduct sales and profit analysis reports (by brand/SKU), FOC calculation, and discount calculation by reviewing sales performance, cost structures, and operational expenses to support strategic decision-making.

- Manage invoicing, payments, and journal entries.

- Handle payroll processing and generate monthly payslips.

- Monitor and manage Accounts Payable.

- Reconcile monthly financials and verify payment records.

- Reconcile e-commerce income and order reports (Shopee, Lazada etc.).

- Support stock counts, shipping documentation and update product margin reports using Bigseller.

- Prepare and Monitor tax filings (GST, corporate tax, income tax, etc.) and contributions (CPF, EPF, etc.)

- Collaborate with other departments for adhoc tasks.



Qualifications:



- Degree in Finance, Accounting, or any related field.

- 3-5 years experience in a finance/accounting role (preferably in e-commerce, retail, or operation industries).

- Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets and accounting software (e.g.,QuickBooks).

- Familiar with tax regulations (e.g., GST, CPF, Corporate Tax – Singapore, Malaysia).

- Experience in financial and profit analysis.

- High level of integrity, accountability, and professionalism.

- Proven ability to manage deadlines, prioritize tasks, and work independently in a fast-paced environment.

- Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or w/ bookkeeping certification is an advantage.



Benefits:

- Stable full time with leave benefits, public holiday benefits, birthday leave.

- Opportunity to be part of a growing Finance team and Korean Beauty Brands.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.

title: Exeuctive Assistant
description:
You're going to take my current resume and change it for every single job applicaiton. We will be using a AI software, copying the job description, and asking it to print out a tailored resume for that job. You will format my resume so it beats the ATS system and apply to the jobs. You will also write cover letters if required. All of this will be monitored by me and screen recorded to make sure that during your time you're only working on this assignment. 





If you're interested in this role, only apply with a link to 3 jobs within my scope. I am looking for ecommerce/operations jobs in the bay area, minimum pay will be $100,000 dollars an hour. the job has to be posted within the past 7 days.



Any application that does not have the required 3 jobs will not be considered. If you are able to follow simple intructions and show that you're good at this, I will pay more.

title: Client Communication Assistant (Remote)
description:
Client Communication Assistant



Are you organized, dependable, and ready to build your career in a growing remote team? We’re looking for Client Communication Assistants who are confident with written English, comfortable using technology, and enjoy helping clients through clear, friendly, and efficient online communication.



This is a non-voice role so you’ll handle messages, guide clients through processes, and make sure every interaction feels effortless and professional. No sales background needed.





What You’ll Be Doing

- Manage inbound and outbound client communication

- Follow communication systems to qualify inquiries and maintain interest

- Coordinate with tea
mbers to ensure updates and follow-ups are handled smoothly

- Keep client records organized and communication consistent



What You’ll Need

- Excellent written English with strong grammar and tone awareness

- Availability for an 8-hour shift, 6 days per week

- Reliable computer and stable internet connection

- Accountability, professionalism, and great attention to detail



What You’ll Get

- Fixed working hours and predictable schedule

- Guaranteed, on-time pay

- Paid training beginning on your first day

- Bonuses based on reliability and performance

- Real opportunities for growth within the team



Compensation

- Most tea
mbers earn between Php45,000–Php80,000/month, depending on consistency and output.



Complete our quick application form here:


/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSflyneasXjmd9_2F81ldYIiFmqugsJQniRn4MiS8_1qK0sv6g/viewform?usp=publish-editor 



If you’re passionate about clear communication, consistent quality, and professional growth, this role could be the perfect fit. We’d love to hear from you!

title: Customer Service Representative (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
We’re Hiring: Customer Service Representative (Full-Time, Remote)



Love helping people and want a stable remote job? We’re looking for someone dependable, organized, and great with written communication to join our team as a Customer Service Representative. If you’ve got strong English skills, a calm attitude, and the discipline to stick to a schedule, this might be the perfect fit.





What You’ll Be Doing:



You’ll be chatting with customers, answering questions, solving small issues, and making sure every interaction feels positive and personal. It’s full-time, 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, and completely remote — all you need is a computer, good internet, and focus.





What Makes You a Great Fit:



- You write clearly and confidently in English

- You’re patient, kind, and great at problem-solving

- You show up on time, stay consistent, and take pride in your work





What’s in It for You:



- Stable full-time schedule (with one day off per week)

- Reliable pay you can count on

- Paid training from day one

- Earn $1000+/month, depending on performance and consistency

- Growth opportunities and bonuses for great performance





Ready to Join Us?



Apply here:

 



Don’t wait! Apply now and start your remote career with us!

description:

Responsibilities:

   •   Use AI tools/websites to animate photos into music videos (experience required)

   •   Edit and refine videos for platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube

   •   Schedule and post content consistently across social media platforms

Requirements:

   •   Proven experience with AI music video tools (examples or portfolio required)

   •   Strong video editing skills

   •   Experience managing and scheduling social media posts

   •   Familiar with Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube

title: Senior Helpdesk Engineer
description:
HOW TO APPLY:



If you feel this position aligns with your skills and experience, please fill out the application form here:


/bepartofourteam.





We’re looking for a hands-on senior IT professional who can support clients at all levels while also leading or assisting with IT projects and driving innovative solutions.

Our senior tea
mbers are critical to supporting our awesome clients and their users. They leverage industry-leading tools and expertise to resolve complex issues, prevent future problems, and improve client IT environments.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys solving challenging technical problems while also designing and implementing improvements that make a real impact.



Key Responsibilities:



Client Support (All Levels)



Provide technical support to clients via phone,
, and remote access—handling everything from basic troubleshooting to advanced escalations.

Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues for multiple clients.

Perform O365 and Windows administration, user account management, and access provisioning.

Support and troubleshoot VOIP systems (e.g., 3CX).

Manage and maintain RMM and PSA tools (e.g., Datto, Halo).

Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance to improve team troubleshooting skills.





Projects & Innovation



Lead or assist with IT projects, e.g cloud migrations, system upgrades, deployments, and process automation etc.

Identify and implement solutions to reduce recurring issues and improve efficiency.

Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts to automate routine tasks and streamline operations.

Collaborate with vendors and clients to plan, test, and deliver new IT solutions.



Documentation & Communication



Log issues and resolutions accurately for future reference.

Communicate effectively with clients and vendors to ensure smooth resolutions and project delivery.



Requirements



Previous experience working in an MSP environment is a plus.

Excellent communication skills – able to have comfortable, friendly conversations in English without being overly formal or technical.

Strong attention to detail and follow-through – “never let it go until it’s solved.”

Demonstrable experience working with Windows systems (client/server) and O365 administration.

Proficiency in advanced troubleshooting methodologies.

Scripting skills, particularly in PowerShell, to automate tasks and improve efficiency.

Experience with VOIP systems and a solid understanding of network infrastructure.

Familiarity with RMM and PSA platforms used in MSP environments (e.g., Datto, Halo).

We are heavy users of Office 365 and Azure, so you’ll need to have solid experience and know the fundamentals or demonstrate skills in something very similar..

Ability to handle difficult tasks, set proper expectations, and deliver solutions within a reasonable timeframe.

Out-of-the-box thinker – proactive, creative, and always looking to improve processes.

Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure client satisfaction.

Ability to “figure things out,” even when facing new or unfamiliar technologies.

title: Content Manager and Designer for Finance-Focused YouTube Channel
description:
I'm looking for a versatile Content Manager and Designer to join my team. This person will help manage and grow my finance-focused newsletter and social media presence, and create engaging, visually appealing content from my YouTube videos.



Key Responsibilities:



- Newsletter Management: Write and edit engaging weekly newsletters on Substack, repurposing video content into written form.

- Graphic Design: Create high-quality graphics for newsletters, social media, eBooks, and PDFs using Canva or similar tools.

- Content Repurposing: Extract and repurpose key points from YouTube videos into written content for newsletters, blogs, and social media posts.

- Social Media Management: Manage and schedule posts, engage with the community, and help grow our online presence.



Ideal Candidate:



- Strong writing and editing skills, especially in the finance niche.

- Proficient in graphic design tools like Canva.

- Experience in content repurposing and social media management.

- Familiarity with the finance or personal finance space is a plus.

- Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently.



How to Apply:

Please provide examples of previous work, especially in newsletter management, graphic design, and content repurposing. Let me know why you're a great fit for this role!



Also there is a test task to apply - please ask for the test task.

title: Framer Web Designer
description:
Position Overview

- Seeking a Framer-focused Web Designer to support ongoing client work for a growing web design agency serving local service businesses. This role involves turning client requirements into clean, modern, conversion-optimized websites with fast turnaround times. You will work directly with the founder on layouts, revisions, and delivering final publish-ready websites.



Responsibilities

- Design and build custom websites in Framer for local service businesses including landscapers, contractors, real estate professionals, home services, and other small business categories.

- Translate client notes, reference sites, and examples into a clear site layout and finished design.

- Create responsive, high-performing pages that load quickly and follow best UI/UX practices.

- Develop sections such as hero layouts, service pages, pricing, FAQs, contact forms, team sections, headers/footers, and project galleries.

- Implement dynamic, interactive, and animated components when appropriate.

- Maintain brand consistency using provided colors, logos, and assets.

- Handle revisions promptly and maintain organized project files.

- Communicate clearly with the founder, provide status updates, and hit agreed deadlines.

- Assist with occasional logo design or small branding tasks for clients as needed.



Requirements

- Strong experience building full websites in Framer.

- Clean design aesthetic: minimal, modern, professional layouts.

- Ability to create dynamic, interactive sections using Framer’s built-in tools.

- Comfortable working without strict templates; able to design from scratch.

- Understanding of layout structure, spacing, typography, and mobile responsiveness.

- Fast, reliable, and able to deliver quality work consistently.

- Strong English communication skills.

- Ability to handle multiple projects at once and work under tight timelines.

- Experience creating simple logos or brand assets is a plus.

- Knowledge of local service business website best practices is a plus.



How to Apply

- Provide links to your Framer portfolio or live sites.

- Include a short overview of your experience, availability, and typical project turnaround time.



I look forward to reviewing your application



- Jack Murray

title: Vision Billing Specialist
description:
Position Summary



The Vision Billing Specialist is responsible for accurate and timely billing and submission of vision insurance claims for exams, eyewear, and contact lenses. This role plays a critical part in revenue integrity by ensuring claims are transmitted correctly, orders are processed in a timely manner, orders are properly documented in RevolutionEHR, and communication between billing and in-office teams is clear, timely, and solution-oriented.



Key Responsibilities:



Submit vision insurance claims for Comprehensive exams and optical materials.

Ensure claims are submitted accurately, completely, and within payer timelines.

Review claims for errors, missing information, or eligibility issues prior to submission.

Resolve claim rejections and denials by identifying root causes

RevolutionEHR Documentation

Verify that exam, optical, and contact lens orders are correctly linked to claims

Maintain up-to-date and accurate billing records within the EHR system

Communicate effectively with in-office staff regarding, billing discrepancies or missing documentation, claim status updates, anything needing corrections or follow-ups

Collaborate with the Revenue Cycle and Optical teams to improve billing workflows and efficiency



Qualifications & Skills:

Experience with vision insurance billing (VSP, EyeMed, Spectera, etc.) preferred

Familiarity with RevolutionEHR  preferred

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple claims and priorities efficiently

Team-oriented mindset with a customer-service-focused approach

Monthly fixed pay. Please include portfolio and availability for 20–25 store builds/month.

description:

Ideal Candidate:

- Previous experience in a Customer Service role

- Adobe Lightroom/Photoshop experience is preferred but not required; includes re-touching and resizing images for multiple platforms

- Extreme attention to detail

The Role:

 communications efficiently and effectively between customers and suppliers via

title: Client & Venue Operations Assistant (Virtual)
description:
We are a UK-based events company providing DJ and entertainment services for weddings, corporate events, universities and private functions.



We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to manage client communications, follow-ups and venue outreach. This role is focused on organisation, consistency and execution - not sales or pricing decisions.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Respond to client enquiries via
, instagram and WhatsApp using templates

 • Send pricing, invoices and booking forms

 • Follow up on enquiries, invoices and booking forms

 • Update Google Sheets with leads, bookings and payments

 • Send and follow up cold
s to venues (training + templates provided)

 • Maintain a list of venues and preferred supplier relationships



Important Notes:

 • You will not negotiate pricing

 • You will follow clear systems and checklists

 • Attention to detail and reliability are critical



This role suits someone who is organised, calm under routine work and comfortable with repetitive tasks done accurately.



WAGE/SALARY:

$3.55/hr (starting rate) + performance bonuses.

30-day probation/trial period with structured review. Pay increase available after 30 days based on performance and reliability.



BONUS:

Bonuses available for consistent performance (fast response times, accurate admin, daily follow-ups) and for each confirmed booking generated through follow-ups/outreach (tracked).

title: Google Ads Specialist (Remote)
description:
Google Ads Specialist (Hourly)





REFUGE Marketing and Consulting is looking for a Google Ads Specialist.

- This is an hourly position averaging 5-15 hours per week, work availability overlapping CST/CDT mornings.

- Rate is $10 -$15 per hour depending on the applicant's experience

Once shortlisted for the position, you will undergo a paid test project so that we can further assess your skills in the role that we are looking for.





Role Overview



As a Google Ads Specialist, you are expected to manage multiple client accounts across diverse industries, developing paid search strategies, and optimizing campaigns for performance. This role involves:

Planning, executing, and optimizing paid search campaigns to drive targeted traffic and achieve business goals

Manage keyword research, manage budget, ad copy, bidding strategies, and performance tracking to maximize ROI across Google Ads platforms





Job Responsibilities:



Campaign Strategy & Setup

- Develop and implement Google Ads strategies to meet account goals.

- Set up and manage Search, Display, Shopping, YouTube, and Performance Max campaigns.

- Conduct keyword research and competitor analysis.

- Support Sales team by creating forecast conversions/targets on a lead account



Campaign Management & Optimization

- Monitor performance daily and make data-driven adjustments to improve CTR, CPC, CPA, and ROI.

- Perform A/B testing on ad copy, creatives, and landing pages.

- Optimize bidding strategies, budget allocations, and audience targeting.



Performance Analysis & Reporting

- Prepare and present weekly and monthly performance reports using Google Ads, Google Analytics, and other tools.

- Identify trends and insights to recommend actionable improvements.

- Track conversion metrics and ensure proper tagging and tracking (e.g., with GTM).



Collaboration & Communicatio

- Work closely with the marketing, design, and sales teams to align campaigns with broader business goals.

- Communicate campaign status, performance updates, and strategy pivots to stakeholders or clients.



Compliance & Best Practices

- Stay updated with Google Ads policy changes and best practices.

- Ensure all campaigns comply with platform guidelines and brand standards.

- Ensure the accounts’ Google Ads Advertiser’s Verification Status is updated to avoid pausing of campaigns

- Ensure REFUGE keeps the Google Ads Badge by taking and passing certifications



Documentation

- Keep updated Client Documentation for strategy and centralized information

- Write at least 1 case study each month on a client campaign that performed well.



Qualifications:

- 3+ years of experience managing Google Ads campaigns

- Proficiency in Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, CallRail and ClickCease

- Experience with keyword research tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs).

- Familiarity with CRO, landing page design, and conversion tracking.

- Certifications are a plus: Google Ads Search Certification, Google Ads Display Certification, Google Ads Measurement 

- Certification, Google Analytics Certification

- Communicate with the rest of the REFUGE team to share strategies, insights, and more.

- Able to attend Weekly Team huddles.

title: Operations & Systems Assistant (Remote, Part-Time)
description:
Operations & Systems Assistant (Remote, Part-Time)

Pay: $4–6/hr (paid weekly)

Hours: 10–20 hrs/week to start (flexible, async-friendly)

Start: ASAP (24–48 hours)



Role Summary



This role is best suited for someone who is grounded, calm under pressure, takes quiet pride in support work, and enjoys creating stability for leaders and teams.



You are comfortable working behind the scenes, don’t require constant direction, and take ownership of the systems and tasks entrusted to you. You value clarity over chaos, follow-through over urgency, and consistency over intensity.



You enjoy organizing information, maintaining structure, and protecting 
ntum so others can operate at their highest level. You find satisfaction in being dependable, thoughtful, and steady — especially in fast-moving environments.



This is not a reactive or emotionally demanding role. It’s designed for someone who prefers focused work, clear expectations, and meaningful contribution without noise.



This Role Is Not For You If…

	•	You need constant direction, reminders, or external motivation to complete tasks

	•	You prefer fast-paced, high-stimulation environments or frequent real-time interaction

	•	You feel anxious when expectations are clear but autonomy is high

	•	You enjoy brainstorming, ideation, or strategy more than execution and upkeep

	•	You need visibility, praise, or validation to feel engaged in your work

	•	You struggle with follow-through, organization, or maintaining systems once they’re built

	•	You are looking for a coaching, creative, or decision-making role



This role is best suited for someone who finds fulfillment in stability, clarity, and quiet excellence, and who takes pride in being the person others can rely on without friction.



Responsibilities

	•	Maintain and update internal systems (Notion, calendars, documents) so information is accurate, current, and easy to find

	•	Own task tracking and follow-through so priorities don’t live in DMs, memory, or verbal threads

	•	Manage calendar coordination, scheduling, and rescheduling with clarity and discretion

	•	Organize links, files, and assets so nothing important gets lost or duplicated

	•	Support basic operational workflows (client onboarding steps, admin handoffs, internal checklists)

	•	Flag gaps, bottlenecks, or inconsistencies early — calmly and constructively

	•	Handle routine administrative tasks without needing constant oversight or reminders

	•	Protect the leader’s focus by absorbing logistical and organizational load

	•	Communicate clearly, concisely, and proactively when something needs attention



What I'm Looking For

 • Organized, calm, proactive

 • Comfortable with Notion or fast to learn

 • Strong written communication

 • Can untangle messy systems and rebuild them clean

 • Takes ownership without micromanagement

Bonus: Experience with coaches/creators, scheduling-heavy roles, wellness/fitness businesses



What This Role Is Not

 • You are not coaching clients

 • You are not making business strategy decisions

 • You are not expected to "do everything"

 • You are expected to own systems and execution within your lane



How to Apply (answer all five)

1. Short intro + location/timezone

2. Relevant experience (systems, admin, Notion, etc.)

3. Weekly availability (hours + preferred working windows)

4. One example of a system you improved or organized

5. Expected hourly rate within $4–6/hr

Hiring fast. Paying weekly.

title: Looking for someone to cold call on sellers behalf
description: Acacia Asset Management Group has a number of properties in South Carolina that we're looking to sell. We're looking for someone who can cold call buyers they find online. A list of buyers will not be provided. The list of properties and asking price will be provided.

title: E-commerce Operations & Systems Lead
description:
(Shopify + Klaviyo + ShipHero | Part-Time / Fractional, Long-Term)



About Totono

Totono is a premium wellness brand focused on natural, infrared-based recovery products. We sell DTC via Shopify and Amazon and are in an active rebrand and operational scale-up phase.

We are a lean team that values speed, reliability, and ownership over meetings, theory, or hand-holding.



The Role

We’re looking for a hands-on E-commerce Operations & Systems Lead whose core responsibility is simple:

Keep Shopify, Klaviyo, and ShipHero cleanly connected and functioning — without founder babysitting.

This is an execution and systems role, not a marketing, strategy, or ideation role.



Core Responsibilities

1. Shopify Website Operations

Maintain Shopify theme health and site stability

Implement and QA website updates (pages, sections, content changes

Troubleshoot checkout issues, app conflicts, and site bugs

Ensure site changes go live correctly and on time







2. Klaviyo & Data Execution (Technical)

Implement Klaviyo flows (post-purchase, repeat purchase, surveys)

Configure buttons/links that write to profile properties (not just
 replies)

Manage tags, custom properties, and segmentation logic

Ensure customer data is stored cleanly for long-term analysis







3. ShipHero Awareness & Sync Monitoring

Ensure Shopify ? ShipHero order sync is healthy

Spot and flag sync errors, fulfillment mismatches, or delays

Coordinate with founder or 3PL only when issues arise

No daily fulfillment management required — systems oversight only







4. Systems, Integrations & Web Builds

Shopify ? Klaviyo ? ShipHero plumbing

Domain, DNS,
, and authentication checks

App installs, configuration, QA, and cleanup

Light HTML/CSS or theme edits when needed





Bonus / Strong Plus:

Ability to build or rebuild simple, clean WordPress sites

Comfortable using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Copilot, etc.) to accelerate builds, edits, and troubleshooting

Focus on speed, clarity, and “good enough shipped” — not over-engineering







5. Execution Ownership

Turn requests into shipped updates without reminders

Proactively communicate timelines and completion

QA before and after every change

Flag risks early instead of reacting late





What This Role Is NOT

Not a marketer

Not a copywriter

Not a designer

Not a fulfillment manager

Those roles are already covered.



Required Skills

Shopify (themes, apps, checkout awareness)

Klaviyo (flows, properties, segmentation)

ShipHero integration familiarity (not daily ops)

Basic HTML/CSS

Strong troubleshooting mindset

Clear written communication

High reliability and follow-through







Working Style & Expectations

Part-time (5–10 hours/week to start)

Long-term preferred

You own execution, not just tasks

You confirm completion proactively

title: Supply Chain & Sourcing Manager (China-USA | Monthly Retainer)
description:
Overview 

We are an emerging US-based gift brand seeking a detail-oriented Sourcing & Import Specialist for a long-term monthly partnership. You will be responsible for the end-to-end process of finding manufacturers, calculating the total cost of goods, and navigating the complexities of importing from China to the USA.





Key Responsibilities:



- Supplier Identification: Research and vet high-quality manufacturers in both China and the USA to support a diverse product catalog.



- Landed Cost Analysis: For every potential product, you must provide a "Landed Cost" report. This includes unit price, shipping, insurance, and all applicable duties.



- Tariff & HTS Expertise: Correctly identify HTS Codes for new products and calculate Section 301 (China-specific) tariffs to ensure there are no surprise costs at the border.



- Sample Management: Coordinate the production and shipping of prototypes/samples and provide quality control feedback.



- Negotiation: Negotiate Minimum Order Quantities (MOQs), payment terms, and lead times to protect our cash flow and deadlines.



- Logistics Oversight: Work with freight forwarders to manage the movement of goods (Sea/Air) and ensure all US Customs documentation is accurate.





Qualifications:



- Experience: Minimum 3+ years in China-to-USA sourcing and supply chain management.



- Technical Knowledge: Deep understanding of US Customs regulations, HTS classification, and the current US-China trade tariff landscape.



- Tools: Proficient in Alibaba, 1688, Global Sources, and the USITC Tariff database.



- Communication: Fluent in English; ability to manage vendors across different time zones. (Mandarin/Cantonese is a plus but not required).



- Category Knowledge: Experience in the "Gifts" or "General Merchandise" category is highly preferred.





Work Structure:



- Type: Monthly Retainer.



- Location: Remote.



- Reporting: Daily progress reports on supplier outreach and cost comparisons.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
Omega Holdings is a private equity-owned leading distributor of air conditioning and other high demand aftermarket components to a broad range of light-duty and heavy-duty vehicle end markets. Omega has created a unique, market leading platform in the automotive aftermarket with numerous opportunities to apply its repeatable playbook to grow both organically and through acquisition. With our product portfolio, dedication to quality, entrepreneurial setting, and competitive strength, we are a great place to build a lasting career.



Omega Holdings is the largest independent after-marketer of heavy-duty air conditioning and heating components in the United States. Omega Holdings is searching for a skilled Accounts Payable Specialist to join our accounting team to help process, track, and record payments in an accurate, efficient, and timely manner. The AP specialist will have a daily, ongoing impact on financial transactions, keeping us on track, on time, and on good terms with our valued partners.



Job Summary:

The Accounts Payable Specialist will perform a wide range of accounting tasks in general accounting, which are routine in nature. The Accounts Payable Specialist will be responsible for reconciling accounts, processing expense invoices, verifying information, performing daily balancing including researching and solving outages, files and preparing accounting reports.



Duties/Responsibilities:

• Manages all aspects of Accounts Payable, ensuring timely and accurate reporting and payments.

• Receives and verifies expense reports; reconciles expense and other financial reports with account balances and other

office records.

• Assists with accounting records and ledgers by reconciling monthly statements and transactions.

• Processes weekly bill payments and records cash entries as needed.

• Facilitates payment of vendors, which may include verification of federal ID numbers, review purchase orders, and

resolving discrepancies.

• Maintains Vendor files and other clerical work.

• Handles administrative tasks as needed.

• Provides customer service to internal business partners.

• Ensures invoices, checks, and other documents are properly sorted, logged, scanned, and filed.

• Other related duties as assigned.



Required Skills/Abilities:

• Must possess a fundamental understanding of the standard concepts, practices, and procedures of

accounting/bookkeeping.

• Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related programs.

• Must be able to learn other accounting software systems.

• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to maintain confidential and meticulous records.

• Ability to multitask, follow up on pending items, work independently, and meet deadlines.



Preferred Skills/Abilities:

• Distribution, Manufacturing, or retail Industry experience is preferred.

• Experience with Continia, Microsoft Business Central or Microsoft Navision a plus.

• 3-way match to purchase order, packing list, to invoice processing experience

• Bi-lingual Spanish speaker a plus.



Education and Experience Requirements:

• High school diploma required, Business or Accounting degree preferred.

• Previous accounts payable experience preferred.



Omega Holdings is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Content Editor and Proofreader
description:
We are looking for a highly organised and detail-oriented Content Flow Manager to keep our content pipeline running smoothly from draft to publish. You will play a key role in coordinating between writers, designers, and other tea
mbers, ensuring that every piece of content moves quickly through reviews, edits, and approvals without delays.



This is not a writing-from-scratch role but most of the content and keywords will already be generated. Your focus will be on editing, formatting, quality checking, and making sure each piece is ready to go live on time and in the right format for its platform.



Key Responsibilities

- Review drafts for grammar, clarity, spelling, and basic tone alignment before they move forward.

- Format and adapt content for different platforms (e.g. LinkedIn, Reddit, blog, website).

- Coordinate workflow between writers, designers, and stakeholders to keep projects on track.

- Run final quality checks on links, formatting, images, and accessibility basics before publishing.

- Maintain content calendars and track the progress of each piece to avoid delays.

- Brief image creation (AI-generated or designer) and review visual assets for consistency.

- Ensure published content follows brand guidelines and style preferences.

- Provide clear feedback and request revisions where needed.

- Work with GTM engineers to maintain core search keyword and phrase content so that rankings targets are not diluted



Must-Have Skills



- Strong English grammar and editing skills with an eye for detail.

- Proven experience editing or coordinating digital content.

- Comfortable working across multiple platforms and content formats.

- Highly organised, with the ability to track and manage many moving parts.

- Good communication skills and confident in following up, requesting revisions, and keeping projects moving.

- Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Notion, Trello, or similar workflow systems.



Nice-to-Have Skills



- Understanding of tone and brand voice, with the ability to make light edits to match a “challenger” or opinion-led style.

- Experience adapting content for different platforms (LinkedIn, Reddit, etc.).

- Experience briefing or reviewing images and visual assets.



What Success Looks Like



- Content moves from draft to publish quickly, with minimal back-and-forth.

- Every post is error-free, properly formatted, and ready to publish on time.

- The wider team spends more time on strategy and creation while you handle the workflow.



Please send your resume and portfolio to

title: YouTube Video Editor (Finance) – Long Form & Motion Graphics
description:
I am seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Video Editor to spearhead the production of high-quality, long-form educational content (10–25 minutes) within the finance niche. You will be responsible for transforming a provided script and voiceover into a visually engaging, professional YouTube video that maintains a clean, "finance explainer" aesthetic using our 2D cartoon style character.



This begins as a single-project contract to assess fit, with the immediate opportunity to transition into a recurring, long-term partnership for the right candidate. For this gig, the video will be 10-15 mins.



The Role

You will be provided with a complete script and a high-quality voiceover file. Your primary responsibility is the visual execution. This role requires a strong grasp of 2D animation and visual storytelling. You must be able to utilize provided character assets and ensure they remain consistent in style, movement, and presence throughout the duration of the video. A sense of humor to make the character funny and a bit self deprecating so the audience can relate to her in a hard to understand/ intimidating niche such as finance would be an added bonus. Would like the imagery to be minimal and not overwhelming to the viewer or cluttered on the screen.



Key Responsibilities

* Full Video Construction: For this gig - Edit 10-12 minute video based on provided audio and script. 

* Character Management: Ensure main character maintain consistency across various scenes and environments.

* Motion Graphics: Integrate clean, minimalist animations, data visualizations (charts/graphs), and text overlays to explain complex financial concepts.

* Pacing & Retention: Maintain a high level of viewer engagement through strategic cutting, zooming, and visual transitions.

* Brand Alignment: Adhere to a "clean minimalist" aesthetic—utilizing soft palettes and professional layouts.



Requirements

* Proven Experience: A portfolio showcasing long-form YouTube content, specifically in the finance, tech, or educational niches.

* Animation Proficiency: Advanced skills in creating motion/ animation to add to the story.

* Character Continuity: Experience working with static or layered character assets and keeping them "on-model" throughout a long edit.

* Efficiency: Ability to meet deadlines without sacrificing the "premium" feel of the content.

* Communication: Highly responsive and open to iterative feedback during the initial trial phase.



Application Instructions

Please provide a link to your portfolio or specific examples of:

* Finance or "Explainer" style videos you have edited. If you've developed videos in other niches that is ok.

* Examples of work where you managed character consistency and 2D animations.
