title: Insurance Verification Specialist
description:
Company Background:

A quickly growing real estate investment company is seeking a new tea
mber to help guide families through the process of purchasing their forever home. We pride ourselves on helping them by solving a problem they didn’t think there was a solution for.  We have had people cry because they were so thankful that we purchased their house or sold them a home.  We also help people buy a home that wouldn’t qualify for a traditional bank loan.  It is an excellent and exciting feeling!



Our positions do not require prior real estate experience because we will slowly teach the industry.  We have a hard-working yet fun and energetic team that is mainly remote-based.  We spend time on professional and personal development for all employees and end the week with Dad Joke Fridays.



This is an excellent opportunity to learn more about the real estate industry and the non-retail method of buying and selling properties.  You will work closely with the business owner and take on more responsibilities over time.  We are only looking for a full-time role but are flexible with our work schedule as we don’t track sick or time off days, you are a professional and would be treated that way.  



Job Description:

As our Insurance Verification Specialist, you will use your strong communication skills with buyers and tenants to refine their insurance needs.  After the disposition team sells a property, you will manage the intricate details with the homeowner/tenant, mortgage company, and insurance provider.  This role requires attention to detail and good problem-solving skills as you will be helping people through one of the most stressful activities of their lives: buying their family home.



With your strong analytical skills, you will review and verify policies, ensuring accuracy and compliance throughout transactions, and be the single point of contact for both the buyer/tenant and the loan servicing company. You will be responsible for maintaining an up-to-date record of tasks in Salesforce, our CRM.



We are looking for someone who is detail-oriented and dedicated and possesses excellent organizational skills. The more experience you have in real estate, the better, but it is not required for this role.  We will conduct on-the-job training as you grow into the role over time.  



Messages from current tea
mbers: Here is a collection of short videos from existing tea
mbers on their thoughts on working with us.  We pride ourselves on our culture and would love to add you to our team:  
 



Responsibilities and Duties:

* Enter insurance details into Salesforce

* Communicate with Insurance companies to update records and manage claims

* Provide borrowers with a list of insurance agents and assist in obtaining coverage

* Manage insurance renewals by communicating with borrowers and renters

* Serve as a liaison between all parties involved, establishing effective communication channels until closing.

* Maintain an updated record of all completed tasks in the Salesforce CRM

* Organize and maintain document filing in our database.

* Update the seller's insurance contact details for our records.

* Obtain insurance quotes from agents for newly contracted properties.

* Cancel the seller's insurance policy after closing and ensure the refund is sent to our designated mailing address

* Secure new insurance policies for newly purchased properties.

* Build training guides to outline all processes you complete regularly

* Perform a variety of other miscellaneous tasks



Perks:

* $5.40/hr ($11,232/year)

* $50.00 Bonus when we sell a property (estimated $1,750/year)

* .5% Commission on insurance claims paid out (estimated $1,125/year)

* Health Insurance 

* Flexible work schedule

* 13th month pay

* We want to make sure you are well compensated for your work efforts and are only looking for full-time employees.



Qualifications

* Bachelor’s Degree

* VA experience for at least 2 years

* Attention to detail across all projects

* Fluent in English - written and verbal

* Proficient with Google Drive/Docs/Sheets, Salesforce, Dropbox, and Slack

* Familiar with Mac; if you don't have one, we can help you get one if so desired 

* Consistent, reliable, and fast internet connection

  

---------------

Why should you join us over anyone and everyone else? 

1) Steady paycheck with the chance for bonuses based on performance 

2) Opportunity to work from home without a boss breathing down your neck 

3) Team environment where you work with others to share the workload



How do you know if you’re qualified for this opportunity? 

We don’t care if you have prior experience in the real estate field.  We can teach you everything you need to know about our clients and our field so you can excel at your job.  We can teach anyone with a good attitude who is self-motivated for more.  These are things you must demonstrate in the interview process. 



The working hours? 

As I stated before, our company is based in Texas, so we require you to work during US business hours, preferably 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM CST (with an hour off for lunch) or 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM CST.  There is some flexibility here, but you would interact with us during business hours and follow up with U.S. companies and families living in the Central Standard Time zone.



What about pay?

We are serious about hiring someone and are looking to fill this position ASAP.  I also want this to be a real job that can meet your financial needs.  We pay your 13th month pay, bonuses, annual pay increases, etc. 



What about the 13th Month? 

Do we pay the 13th month?  Of course, we do.  It’s part of Filipino culture, and we want to be a part of it too. We pay half of the 13th month in the 3rd quarter for school supplies, etc., for your kids (or whatever else you choose) and the other half right before Christmas. 



What happens next? 

Since our jobs are so popular, we generally get deluged with applicants.  So, I have designed a multi-part interview process to make the process simple and efficient for all parties.  



The first part of the interview process is designed to examine your English-speaking & writing skills, personality type, internet speed, and ability to follow directions. Please be advised that those who submit incomplete applications will be ignored.



If you make it through this first round, we will talk via video chat to answer any questions and get to know you better. 



We will then ultimately hire someone, potentially you!!!



How to Apply: 

To submit your application for the job, please complete all of the following and
 them to us at 
 Please complete this quick assessment, as it will be our primary initial qualification: 

* Video yourself looking at the camera and explain why you would be a good fit for this position. Then, send me a link to see your video. 

* Perform an Internet speed test at 
, send a screenshot of your results, and include them in your
 with the video.

* Along with your resume, send us the names of at least 3 references we can contact who would say good things about working with you.  This could be a priest, former employer, bank manager, school teacher, or anyone.  No more than 1 of these people can be a family member.

title: Senior AppFolio Transition Accountant
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a private real estate holding company managing properties across multiple U.S. states. We focus on accurate financials, efficient operations, and modern systems like AppFolio for clear, property-level reporting.



POSITION SUMMARY

Seeking a senior AppFolio Transition & Oversight Specialist for a project-based cleanup of our QuickBooks + Rent Manager to AppFolio migration (live Jan 1, 2025), with strong potential for recurring quarterly reviews.



Primary task: Audit and resolve legacy issues (non-standard clearing accounts, timing mismatches, Nov–Dec 2024 duplicates) by mapping transferable items, executing GAAP-sound adjustments (e.g., immaterial residue to retained earnings per ASC 250 with documentation), and delivering a clean, audit-ready AppFolio foundation.



If the work is excellent, we bring you back quarterly (or as-needed) to review books, run trial balances/financials, check compliance, analyze variances, and ensure ongoing accuracy—without full-time commitment.



Must have proven transition experience and GAAP judgment to avoid audit risks (no excessive patching or dead-end entries). Fully remote (Philippines preferred), via Teams/SharePoint.



PROJECT SCOPE (Initial Cleanup)

- Forensic audit of legacy data; map chart of accounts and bridge entries.

- Reconcile/zero clearing accounts; eliminate duplicates.

- Apply GAAP: materiality calls, prior period error corrections recorded to retained earnings where appropriate (ASC 250), clear memos for decisions.

- Validate final AppFolio balances tie to historicals.

- Deliver: mapping summary, adjustment journals, before/after reconciliation, audit documentation.

- Primary ownership of corrective accounting entries during the cleanup phase, with documented rationale.



Estimated effort: 20–80 hours (1–4 weeks focused), depending on complexity.



RECURRING POTENTIAL

Quarterly oversight (10–20 hours/quarter): Run/review trial balances, P&Ls, compliance reports (trust/escrow), variance analysis; flag issues early; suggest improvements. Flexible—project or retainer basis if mutual fit.



WORK ARRANGEMENT

- Type: Independent contractor – project first, recurring option.

- Duration/Flex: Cleanup sprint; then quarterly as agreed.

- Hours: Flexible with 2–4 hours PST overlap (evenings PH time).

- Location: Remote; Philippines preferred.

- Tools: Reliable internet (20+ Mbps), modern PC/dual monitors. We provide AppFolio access, Teams, SharePoint.



MUST-HAVE QUALIFICATIONS

- 5+ years hands-on U.S. real estate/property accounting.

- 2+ years in software transitions/cleanups (e.g., QB/Rent Manager to AppFolio; share examples of legacy resolutions).

- Advanced AppFolio: property-segmented ledgers, clearing/bridge entries, reports, owner equity.

- Strong GAAP experience required: error corrections, adjustments without creating audit pitfalls. (Prefer: U.S. real estate clients)

- Multi-entity, trust/escrow compliance, fixed assets experience.

- Fluent English; Excel/Teams/AI research proficient.

- Independent, audit-minded, high integrity.



STRONG PLUS

- CPA or equivalent.

- Experience with quarterly reviews/oversight for remote clients.

- Forensic or post-migration work.



COMPENSATION

- Cleanup Project: Exact structure (fixed vs hourly) to be determined after scope confirmation.

- Quarterly Reviews (if extended): $500–$1,500 per quarter (or $15–$25/hour for hours worked), with potential retainer for predictability.

- Paid via PayPal/Wise; paid trial task to start. Bonuses for clean delivery/milestones.



ASSESSMENTS

Transition-focused tests:

- Clean sample legacy clearing into AppFolio; justify GAAP choices/documentation.

- Mock trial balance fix: resolve mismatches, retained earnings plug, audit notes.



TO APPLY

Via OnlineJobs.ph: Resume + cover letter detailing transition projects (challenges, GAAP decisions, outcomes), experience with quarterly oversight if any, preferred project fee, and interest in recurring work. References required. Shortlisted get assessments.



We're looking for someone sharp who can fix it right once, then keep us on track quarterly—let's make the books solid and stay that way!

title: Video Editor For Meta Ads - AI video experience is a big plus

title: Experienced Meta, Google & Multi-Platform Ads Specialist
description:
About the Role

/Instagram), Google Ads, and other digital advertising platforms. This is a long-term role for someone who is proactive, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple campaigns while delivering strong results.

Responsibilities

Analytics & Reporting

title: Freight Dispatcher
description:
We are seeking an experienced and reliable Freight Dispatcher to manage daily dispatch operations for our trucking fleet. This role is responsible for booking loads, coordinating drivers, tracking shipments, ensuring on-time pickups and deliveries, and ensuring we have clear, signed delivery paperwork. The ideal candidate is highly organized, communicates effectively, and understands the urgency and problem-solving nature of trucking operations.



Responsibilities

Dispatch drivers to assigned loads and routes.



Coordinate pickups and deliveries with brokers, shippers, and receivers.



Track loads in real time and provide status updates.



Communicate daily with drivers regarding routes, delays, and issues.



Secure and negotiate freight rates when applicable.



Ensure drivers have correct paperwork (rate confirmations, BOLs).



Monitor Hours of Service (HOS) and ensure DOT compliance.



Resolve breakdowns, delays, or service issues promptly.



Maintain accurate records in TMS and dispatch systems.



Assist with detention, layover, TONU, and accessorial requests.



Qualifications

1+ year experience as a freight dispatcher or similar role required.



Strong knowledge of trucking operations and freight lanes.



Familiarity with load boards (DAT, Truckstop).



Understanding of DOT and FMCSA regulations.



Excellent communication and multitasking skills.



Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.



Proficient with dispatch software and basic computer systems.



Preferred Skills

Experience dispatching owner-operators or company drivers.



Knowledge of FTL, regional, OTR, and local dispatch.



Strong negotiation and problem-solving abilities.

title: Junior Marketing Assistant (AI & Ad Ops)
description:
If you're intelligent & tech-savvy, then you might be what we're looking for.



Location: Remote (Philippines Based Only)

Payment Schedule: Paid bi-monthly via Wise (1st and 16th)



My client and I are looking for a Marketing Assistant to act as the "right hand" to our Marketing Manager. You will work closely with me to execute high-level marketing strategies.



We are not looking for a resume filled with corporate years. We are looking for raw potential, high intelligence, and practical AI skills. If you are quick to learn new technology and want a career path where you are paid to learn high-level digital marketing, this is the role for you.



The Role:

My goal is to train you to handle execution so I can focus on strategy. This role is a continuum—you will start with specific tasks, and as you master them, you will take on more responsibility.



What you will do immediately: 

AI Image Generation: Apply your prompt engineering skills using tools like Gemini Pro (provided by us) and other bots to generate high-quality creative images for ad campaigns.

Creative Iteration: Create variations of winning ad creatives to keep our campaigns fresh and performing well.

Ad Launching: Assist me in setting up and launching basic campaigns (I will teach you the exact process).



The Future (Growth Path): 

Month 1-3: Mastering our specific AI workflows and basic ad operations.

Month 6+: Potential to take over management of video editors and handle higher-level project management.



Who You Are

AI Prompt Engineer: You don't just "know about" AI; you use it daily. You have experience with Prompt Engineering and understand how to structure complex prompts for tools like Gemini, ChatGPT, or Midjourney to get the exact result you want.

High Intelligence: You figure things out. You are a problem solver who doesn’t need your hand held for every small task.

Impeccable English: You must have a strong grasp of the English language, both verbal and written, as you will be crafting detailed prompts and communicating with the team daily.

Tech-Reliable: You have a fast internet connection and a proven backup plan for power outages or internet issues. You must work from a reliable laptop or desktop computer (No phones/tablets).

Coachable: Since we will be working closely together, you must be eager to receive direct feedback and improve immediately.



Compensation & Perks

Competitive Pay: $700 - $800 USD/month starting salary.

Bonus Potential: After a few months of proven performance, you will be eligible for a performance-based bonus structure.

Mentorship: You will be directly mentored by the Marketing Manager, with exposure to the CEO.



How to Apply (Read Carefully)

To ensure we hire someone with great communication skills and attention to detail, applications without a video will not be considered.



Step 1: Record a short video (2-3 minutes max) Please show your face and answer the following three questions specifically:

1. If an AI tool isn't giving you the result you want after 5 tries, what is your specific process for troubleshooting the prompt? Walk me through how you adjust your language or parameters.

2. Describe a specific time you encountered a technical problem (with software or a computer) that you had no idea how to fix. Walk me through the exact steps you took to find the solution before asking for help.

3. Pick a complex concept (it can be anything—crypto, cooking, a video game mechanic) and explain it to me in 30 seconds as if I know nothing about it.



Step 2: Submit your Application 

 the Link to your Resume and your video to: 
 

Subject Line: Marketing Assistant Application - [Your Name]



Note: We may hire two candidates on a 30-day paid trial basis to determine the best long-term fit.

title: Executive Support Specialist – Licensed Professional Tracks
description:
Executive Support Specialist – Licensed Professional Tracks

Reports to: CEO



Role Overview:

We are seeking highly qualified Attorneys, CPAs, or Licensed Educators to provide strategic executive support to the CEO. This role blends professional expertise with high-level administrative responsibilities, requiring discretion, precision, and proactive initiative.



1. Attorney

Responsibilities:

-Provide strategic support to the CEO in legal and executive matters, managing priorities, correspondence, and follow-ups with minimal oversight.

-Review, draft, and finalize contracts, legal memoranda, and other professional documents with precision and adherence to legal standards.

-Maintain and optimize digital and physical documentation systems for legal, corporate, and operational efficiency.

-Track deadlines, filings, and regulatory obligations across multiple projects to ensure compliance and mitigate risk.

-Coordinate legal meetings, court dates, and executive appointments, anticipating scheduling needs.

-Conduct legal research, prepare briefs, and summarize complex legal information for strategic decision-making.

-Handle confidential and sensitive legal and corporate information with the highest ethical standards.

-Identify opportunities to streamline workflows and implement best practices in legal and operational processes.



2. CPA Track

Responsibilities:

-Provide strategic financial and operational support to the CEO, managing priorities, reports, and follow-ups proactively.

-Prepare, review, and analyze financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and professional correspondence with accuracy and compliance.

-Maintain and enhance digital and physical recordkeeping systems to ensure precise financial documentation and reporting.

-Track deadlines, deliverables, and fiscal obligations across multiple projects, ensuring adherence to regulatory and corporate standards.

-Coordinate executive and financial meetings, ensuring seamless scheduling and preparation of supporting materials.

-Conduct financial research, prepare summaries, and provide actionable insights to guide executive decisions.

-Handle sensitive financial and operational information with integrity and discretion.

3. Licensed Educator Track

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) – Real Estate Team
description:
Location: Remote

Reports To: Sales Manager / Team Lead

Type: Full-Time

Compensation: Base + Bonus



Job Summary:

We are looking for a proactive and motivated Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing real estate team. The SDR will play a key role in generating new business opportunities by engaging potential clients, nurturing leads, and setting qualified appointments for our agent team. This position is ideal for someone who is organized, persuasive, and thrives in a fast-paced, goal-driven environment.



Key Responsibilities:

-  Prospect and qualify leads through phone calls, text,
, and CRM outreach.

-  Respond promptly to inbound inquiries from online platforms, social media, or marketing campaigns.

-  Conduct initial needs assessments to understand buyers’ or sellers’ timelines, goals, and motivation.

-  Schedule listing or buyer consultation appointments for senior agents.

-  Maintain accurate records of leads and activity in the team CRM (e.g., Salesforce).

-  Collaborate closely with the marketing and operations teams to optimize lead conversion.

-  Track daily activity metrics — calls, texts,
s, appointments set, and conversion rates.

-  Follow up with past clients, warm leads, and sphere contacts to generate repeat and referral business.

-  Continuously learn about new construction communities, local market trends, and loan products to better engage prospects.



Qualifications:

-  Strong communication and interpersonal skills — comfortable engaging with potential clients over the phone and online.

-  Highly organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple lead sources simultaneously.

-  Prior experience in real estate sales, inside sales, customer service, or telemarketing preferred.

-  Familiarity with real estate CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a plus.

-  Goal-oriented with a strong sense of accountability and urgency.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

-  Lead-to-appointment conversion rate.

-  Response time to inbound leads.

Join Us!

ans being part of a supportive and collaborative environment where your contributions make a real impact. If you’re passionate about real estate operations and ready to grow your career with a company that values excellence and integrity, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Learning Experience Designer (LXD)
description:
As our Learning Experience Designer, you will be the architect of our digital learning ecosystem. You'll take proven workshop content that has been successfully delivered live to corporate clients and transform it into self-paced, engaging eLearning experiences that maintain the same impact and effectiveness.



Your primary responsibilities include:

- Conducting instructional design analysis on existing workshop materials

- Restructuring content for optimal online learning flow and engagement

- Building complete courses in LearnWorlds LMS platform

- Creating interactive elements, assessments, and knowledge checks

- Designing or sourcing visual assets (graphics, infographics, icons)

- Integrating multimedia content (video, audio, animations)

- Ensuring courses meet professional corporate eLearning standards

- Testing and quality assuring all courses before launch

- Creating templates and style guides for consistency

- Documenting processes for future course updates and maintenance



You'll work directly with subject matter experts (our founders and facilitators) who will provide you with all source materials and content expertise. Your job is to be the instructional design expert who transforms this content into exceptional digital learning experiences.



About the Role

We're seeking a talented Learning Experience Designer to help transform our comprehensive suite of corporate wellbeing workshops into engaging, professional eLearning courses on our LearnWorlds LMS platform. You'll be working with high-quality existing content (workbooks, video modules, workshop materials) and redesigning them for optimal digital learning experiences that meet corporate eLearning standards.



This is an opportunity to:

- Build 27+ courses that will impact thousands of professionals globally

- Work with scientifically-backed wellbeing content across multiple topics

- Create learning experiences for clients in maritime, mining, offshore, and corporate sectors across US, Southeast Asia, Europe, and Australia

- Potentially grow into a long-term partnership as we continuously expand our course offerings



Core Responsibilities:

- Instructional Design: Transform existing workshop content into engaging eLearning modules suitable for self-paced corporate learning

- Course Development: Build interactive, visually appealing courses in LearnWorlds LMS

- Content Restructuring: Adapt live workshop formats into effective asynchronous digital learning experiences

- Interactive Elements: Design and implement quizzes, knowledge checks, interactive activities, and assessments

- Visual Design: Create or coordinate graphics, infographics, and visual elements that enhance learning

- Multimedia Integration: Integrate existing video content, audio, and other media effectively

- Quality Assurance: Test courses for functionality, user experience, and learning effectiveness

- Documentation: Create style guides and templates for consistent design across all courses



Initial Project Scope:

Phase 1: Build flagship course (8-9 modules) on sleep science and optimisation to establish templates and design system

Phase 2: Build remaining 26 courses across various wellbeing topics using established templates and systems

Ongoing: Support course updates, new course development, and content maintenance

Stro

ng analytical skills

Dan Connor

title: Google Ads Specialist (Performance-Driven, Detail-Obsessed) Who Loves Halo Halo
description:
hi Kamusta :) We’re looking for a hungry Google Ads expert who lives and breathes optimisation, loves digging into data, and has an almost unhealthy level of attention to detail.



This is not a “set it and forget it” role.

If you get satisfaction from tightening keywords, improving Quality Scores, lowering CPLs, and spotting inefficiencies others miss — you’ll feel at home here.



What You’ll Be Doing



Build, optimise, and scale Google Ads accounts (Search, PMAX, Brand, High-Intent campaigns)



Conduct deep keyword research (search intent, negatives, match types, gaps)



Weekly optimisation cycles (bids, search terms, ads, assets, extensions)



Troubleshoot underperforming campaigns and identify root causes



Improve CTR, Quality Score, CPC, CPL, and overall efficiency



Write and iterate ad copy using ChatGPT, based on proven scripts and frameworks



Maintain clean account structure and documentation



Communicate insights clearly (what changed, why, and expected impact)



What We’re Looking For



Proven experience managing Google Ads accounts with real budgets



Obsessive attention to detail — you notice things others miss



Strong understanding of:



Keyword research & search intent



Match types & negative keywords



Quality Score optimisation



Conversion tracking fundamentals



Comfortable optimising weekly (or more often when needed)



Logical thinker who enjoys troubleshooting and problem-solving



Able to use ChatGPT as a tool, not a crutch



Proactive, self-managed, and improvement-focused



Nice to Have (Not Required)



Experience with lead generation (services, local, high-ticket)



Understanding of funnels & landing page alignment



Experience working with agencies or multiple accounts



Familiarity with reporting and performance summaries



How We Work



Clear KPIs and expectations



Clean processes and account structures



Performance > ego



Long-term mindset (not a short-term gig)



To Apply



Please include:



A short intro on your Google Ads experience



Examples of accounts or results you’ve worked on



How you approach weekly optimisation



Your favourite Google Ads metric to improve — and why



If you’re the kind of person who gets excited about optimisation and hates wasted spend, we want to hear from you.

title: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Quality Assurance Engineer with a strong QA mindset and hands-on experience in manual testing and regression testing. This role is QA first with automation as a supporting function.



This role requires the ability to independently own test planning, execution and quality decisions in a fast-moving environment.



Your primary responsibility is to ensure that all products features integrations, and internal tools function correctly before release. You will also support QA effectiveness through low code automation workflows using n8n or similar tools.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Quality Assurance (Primary Focus)

- Quality Ownership: Act as the final quality gate for product features, integrations, and internal tools prior to deployment.

- Test Planning & Execution: Design, document, and execute comprehensive test cases covering happy paths, edge cases, and failure scenarios.

- Bug Reproduction & Reporting: Convert unclear or high-level issue reports into precise, actionable bug tickets for developers.

- Regression Testing Maintain and execute structured regression test suites to ensure new updates do not break existing workflows or functionality

- Risk Identification: Proactively identify logical gaps, edge cases, and potential failure points during the requirements and testing phases.



2. Automation & n8n Management (Secondary Focus)

- Automation Script Development: Write and maintain basic automation scripts within low code platforms or supporting tools to improve QA coverage workflow validation and testing efficiency.

- Low-Code Workflow Maintenance: Maintain, configure, and improve existing automation workflows using n8n.

- QA Automation Support: Leverage automation to streamline QA activities, such as test data generation, workflow monitoring.

- Monitoring & Troubleshooting: Monitor live automations, diagnose failures (e.g., API or webhook issues), and resolve them or escalate to developers when necessary.



3. Collaboration & Communication

- Cross-Team Bridge: Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and operations teams to translate business requirements into QA coverage and automation logic.

- Risk Communication: Clearly explain technical issues, failures, and risks to non-technical stakeholders without unnecessary jargon.

- Documentation Ownership: Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation for test plans, workflows, and QA processes.

- Feedback Loop: Identify and raise requirement gaps early in the design phase to prevent downstream issues.



Qualifications & Requirements



Required:

- Proven experience in Quality Assurance, with manual testing experience required (automation experience is a plus).

- Strong ability to write structured test plans, test cases, and bug reports.

- Understanding of APIs and webhooks, including how data flows between systems (e.g., POST requests).

- Experience with n8n is highly preferred, or strong experience with Zapier or Make with willingness to upskill.

- Strong logical troubleshooting skills for workflows and integrations.

- High attention to detail with the ability to validate data and outputs across multiple systems.

- Ability to work independently and manage testing tasks with minimal supervision.

Clear written and verbal communication skills.



Nice to Have (Not Required):

- Experience with low-code automation platforms such as Zapier, Make, Airtable, or similar tools.

- Basic technical skills such as using Postman, reading simple JSON, or validating API responses.

- Experience using AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude) for test case generation, documentation, or troubleshooting.

- Familiarity with project management and bug-tracking tools (Jira, ClickUp, Linear, Asana).

- Exposure to SaaS, E-commerce, or CRM workflows, with an understanding of how data moves across business systems.



What We Offer:

- Performance-based bonuses

- Access to automation and AI tools

- Opportunity to work on real-world, high-impact business workflows

- Clear ownership of automation systems

- Long-term growth opportunities in automation and operations

- Supportive team with structured requirements and clear expectations



Working days and hours:

- Full-time basis: 40 hrs/week (Mon-Fri)

- Working hours: 10 am to 6:30 pm (30 min. lunch break)

- 14 days of Paid Annual Leave and Paid Public Holidays Benefits (all major holidays in the Philippines) included



**IMPORTANT**: When applying, please provide:

1. Your CV/Resume

2. A short video introduction of yourself and why you think you're a good fit.

3. Why you are leaving your last job or what were you doing just before this application.

4. Elaborate about your relevant past experience (if any) and why you'd be the best fit for this position. If you do not have experience, please be honest and state so as well.



**Applications without the above 4 points will be less considered.



P.S. Please format your replies in point form according to the 4 items asked above, e.g:



1. My resume is here:

2. Video introduction here:

3. I am doing... etc

4. I have... etc



The more information you provide in your initial application, the better.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Part time Capcut Video Editor for UGC and Tiktok Shop Content
description:
Hiring for part time work currently, with the potential to move to full time in the future. I am a content creator that does Tiktok Shop, UGC, and influencer style videos.



Tasks include: 

Using an editing software of your choice to edit videos

Editing talking head videos - edit dead space and cut out mistakes

Adding overlay images or videos into the video (content provided by me)

Taking b-roll content and editing the best clips into a video, then adding my voiceover audio that I create

Create Tiktok/Reel cover photo/thumbnails to create a cohesive feed



Please look over these videos to see the type of content that you would be working on, and ensure you are comfortable with editing:



Talking head with overlays 





B roll with voiceover





Talking head





Requirements: 

-Attention to detail

-Strong English

-Strong internet connection

-Previous experience with CapCut and Tiktok

-Good working with a team

-Ability to take constructive feedback

-Availability to work 3-4 hours per day (with potential for more in the future)

-Can take payments through Wise

-Able to work 4-5 days per week

-24-72 hour turnaround time 



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below.



Below is a Google Drive link with the original file you will need to create a video in the style of the ones I linked above



Original video: 



Please complete the following steps:

1. Download the files and import into your editing software

2. Find the "good" takes of the audio sections and stitch together to complete the video. If I say a sentence multiple times, usually the final sentence is my best one. I cut my videos very tight, with no extra space so each word needs to flow right into the next one. I usually film about 5-10 minutes and then cut it down to 1-3 minutes total. Your editing software should have an AI feature that automatically takes the dead space out.

3. Message me a link to the completed video



Feel free to also message me examples of similar work that you have completed.

title: Real Estate VA – Land Acquisitions & Junior Dispositions (Part-Time)
description:
Commonwealth Property Holdings (CWPH) is a real estate investment company focused on off-market vacant land opportunities in Phoenix and Scottsdale, AZ, working closely with custom and luxury home builders.



We are looking for a part-time Virtual Assistant to support land acquisitions and junior dispositions. This role is focused on outbound seller calls, CRM management, and qualifying opportunities — not admin busywork.



This is not a sales commission role. Pricing, negotiations, and final decisions are handled by the owner. Your role is to surface and qualify real opportunities and keep the pipeline organized.



Responsibilities:

Outbound calls and follow-ups with vacant land owners

Qualify seller motivation, timeline, and general price expectations

Update and maintain CRM records in HubSpot

Escalate qualified opportunities with clear written summaries

Limited outreach to builders only when authorized

Maintain clean notes and follow-up schedules



Requirements:

Clear, confident English (spoken and written)

Comfortable making outbound calls

Prior experience in real estate, wholesaling, or dispositions preferred

Organized, detail-oriented, and able to follow SOPs

Comfortable working independently with weekly reporting

Compensation & Upside:

Hourly pay based on experience

Part-time (approximately 15–20 hours per week to start)

Discretionary performance bonuses for closed transactions where your work contributed

Long-term opportunity for the right person



To apply, please include a short message describing:

Your experience with outbound calls or real estate

Your availability (hours per week)

Why this role interests you



Applications without a short written response may not be reviewed.

description: Seeking a skilled Government Contracting Specialist to quickly turnaround RFPs and develop compelling proposals. Must have experience with government contracting and a track record of securing contracts. Join our team and help us make an impact.

title: Financial Planning Assistant ( Junior and Senior Roles )
description:
Confident and Ready to Own Your Role? We Want You.



You are not the type to sit quietly and wait for instructions. You see what needs doing and you do it. You communicate clearly, follow up relentlessly, and take pride in getting things right.



Aureus Wealth Advisers is a growing Australian financial planning firm. We are hiring a Case Manager based in the Philippines to support our advisers, paraplanners, and clients. This is a hands-on role for someone who wants real responsibility and genuine impact.



What You Will Do:

Support financial advisers with client preparation, documentation, and follow-up

Support Senior Case Manager ( for Junior Case Manager )

Senior Case Manager will work closely with their own Junior Case Manager

Preparing research in relation to Statements of Advice, annual reviews, and strategy papers

Track advice implementation from start to finish

Keep files compliant and systems updated

Coordinate with product providers to resolve pending applications



We Will Measure Success By:

Data accuracy of 90% or higher

Implementation completed within agreed timeframes

Positive feedback from advisers, Directors, and clients

All compliance and regulatory deadlines met



You Are Perfect For This If You:

Have experience in financial planning administration

Are confident speaking with clients and tea
mbers

Love being organised and hate loose ends

Want to grow with a company that values results over busywork

Are familiar with Xplan or willing to learn quickly



Salary and Perks:

Junior – PHP 45,000 – 50,000 per month

Senior – PHP 70,00 – 75,000 per month

Work with a supportive, no-nonsense Australian team

Opportunity to grow as the business scales



How to apply:

Please click on this link to apply:

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Own the Numbers. Drive the Results. We’re Hiring a Bookkeeper Who Gets It Done.



Want a role where your work actually matters? Where you’re not just processing transactions but building the financial backbone of a growing business?



We’re looking for a Bookkeeper who takes pride in accuracy, spots problems before they happen, and wants to be part of a team that values results over busywork.



Why This Role Rocks:

You’ll have direct impact on profitability and cash control

Your work feeds into real business decisions, not just compliance boxes

You’ll work closely with the Head of Accounting on strategy, not just data entry

You’ll join a team that respects your expertise and gives you room to own your domain



What You’ll Do:

Manage daily transactions, reconciliations, and coding in Xero

Prepare BAS and IAS lodgments on time, every time

Identify every deduction and credit the business is entitled to

Deliver weekly cashflow reports and flag issues early

Keep records audit-proof and compliant

Support month-end and year-end close processes

Contribute to forecasting and tax planning



We’ll Measure Success By:

Bank reconciliations completed within 24 hours

Zero late BAS or IAS lodgments

Less than 1% error rate on coding

Monthly reports delivered by the 5th business day

All eligible deductions and credits claimed



You’re Perfect For This If You:

Have at least 2 years experience as a bookkeeper

Have at least 2 years hands-on experience with Xero

Know Australian tax obligations and BAS inside out

Obsess over accuracy and hate leaving loose ends

Want ownership, not micromanagement

Communicate clearly and flag issues early



Remuneration:

Competitive salary equivalent to experience.

Performance reviews and growth opportunities available



How to Apply:

Please click on this link to apply:

title: Strategic Events Leader - Want to Run Events That Actually Move the Needle?
description:
Are you tired of managing events that exist for the sake of it? Do you want to own an event strategy that directly drives revenue, retention, and growth?



We're a fast-growing business looking for a strategic Event Leader to take full ownership of our event ecosystem. This is not a coordination role. This is a leadership role for someone who thinks commercially, executes flawlessly, and measures success by outcomes.



Why This Role Rocks:



You will own the full event strategy end to end. Your work will directly impact client retention, lead generation, and revenue. You will work with smart, ambitious people who value results over busywork. You will build systems, not events. You will be trusted with real responsibility and autonomy.



What You'll Do:



Design and execute an annual event plan including 3 major in-person events and monthly online pop-ups. Curate compelling speakers and content that drive attendance and engagement. Own all event logistics for in-person events, including venues, AV, staging, materials, and travel coordination. Own event budgets and P&L with clear ROI accountability. Measure performance, collect feedback, and continuously improve the event system. Deliver events that strengthen client relationships and attract future clients.



We'll Measure Success By:



Consistent delivery of a 4x ROI on events. 80%+ client attendance across all events annually. Reduced client churn driven by event participation. Strong feedback and repeat attendance.



You're Perfect for This If You:



Love owning strategy and execution.

Thrive in autonomous, outcome-driven environments.

Think like a marketer and operate like a systems builder.

Care deeply about quality, detail, and results.

Want to build something meaningful rather than do tasks.

Have 3+ years experience in event management with P&L responsibility



Salary & Perks:



$3,000 per month base plus performance bonuses. Fully remote offshore role. Occasional travel may be required for in-person events (all expenses paid). Long-term growth opportunity with a business that values impact and ownership.



How to Apply:



1. Go to the job posting on our website and follow the instructions - 



Applications via OnlineJobs will be ignored.
